Stand facing the anchor point, grip the bar/handles.
Lean forward, body straight, arms extended in front.
Keeping body rigid and upper arms stationary, lower your head towards your hands by bending only at the elbows.
Extend elbows forcefully to push your body back to the starting position.
Adjust foot position to change difficulty (further back = harder).
Repeat.
description: Using bodyweight and a bar or suspension trainer to perform triceps extensions.

name: Overhead Barbell Triceps Extension (Seated)
instructions: Sit on a bench (preferably with back support).
Hold a barbell (straight or EZ bar) with a narrow overhand grip.
Lift the barbell overhead, arms fully extended.
Keeping upper arms stationary and close to head, lower the barbell behind your head by bending elbows.
Lower until a good stretch is felt in triceps.
Extend elbows to push the barbell back to the starting position.
Squeeze triceps.
Repeat.
description: Performing overhead triceps extensions while seated using a barbell.

name: Wide Grip Pull-Up
instructions: Grasp a pull-up bar with an overhand grip significantly wider than shoulder-width.
Hang with arms fully extended, engaging your core.
Pull your body upwards by driving your elbows down towards your sides.
Focus on squeezing your back muscles.
Continue pulling until your chin clears the bar.
Lower your body back down slowly under control until arms are fully extended.
Repeat.
description: A pull-up variation using a wide overhand grip, emphasizing the width of the latissimus dorsi.

name: Medium Grip Pull-Up
instructions: Grasp a pull-up bar with an overhand grip at approximately shoulder-width.
Hang with arms fully extended.
Engage core and pull your body upwards by driving elbows down.
Pull until your chin clears the bar.
Lower slowly under control.
Repeat.
description: The standard pull-up using a shoulder-width overhand grip, balancing lat and bicep involvement.

name: Close Grip Pull-Up
instructions: Grasp a pull-up bar with an overhand grip closer than shoulder-width.
Hang with arms fully extended.
Pull your body upwards, keeping elbows closer to your body.
Pull until chin clears the bar.
Focus on lower lat and arm engagement.
Lower slowly under control.
Repeat.
description: A pull-up variation with a close overhand grip, increasing the range of motion and arm involvement.

name: Chin-Up
instructions: Grasp a pull-up bar with an underhand (supinated) grip, hands shoulder-width apart or slightly closer.
Hang with arms fully extended.
Pull your body upwards, focusing on driving elbows down and back.
Continue pulling until your chin clears the bar.
Feel a strong contraction in the biceps.
Lower slowly under control.
Repeat.
description: A pull-up variation using an underhand grip, strongly emphasizing the biceps muscles.

name: Neutral Grip Pull-Up
instructions: Grasp parallel pull-up handles (palms facing each other).
Hang with arms fully extended.
Pull your body upwards, keeping elbows relatively close.
Pull until chin clears the level of the handles.
Lower slowly under control.
Often considered easier on the shoulders.
Repeat.
description: A pull-up using parallel handles (palms facing each other), often more comfortable for the shoulders and engaging the brachialis.

name: Mixed Grip Pull-Up
instructions: Grasp a pull-up bar with one hand in an overhand grip and the other in an underhand grip.
Hang with arms fully extended.
Pull your body upwards until chin clears the bar.
Lower slowly under control.
Switch grip orientation on subsequent sets or reps.
Repeat.
description: Performing a pull-up with one palm facing forward and the other backward.

name: Weighted Pull-Up / Chin-Up
instructions: Attach weight using a dip belt, weighted vest, or by holding a dumbbell between your feet.
Perform a pull-up or chin-up with your preferred grip.
Maintain good form despite the added resistance.
Pull until chin clears the bar.
Lower slowly under control.
Repeat.
description: Performing pull-ups or chin-ups with additional weight attached to increase resistance.

name: Assisted Pull-Up
instructions: Using an assisted pull-up machine: Set the counterweight assistance level. Kneel or stand on the platform. Grip the handles with desired grip.
Using a band: Loop a resistance band securely around the pull-up bar. Place one knee or foot into the band.
Perform the pull-up/chin-up motion. The machine/band reduces your effective bodyweight.
Pull until chin clears the bar.
Lower slowly under control.
Repeat.
description: Performing pull-ups with assistance from a machine or resistance band to make the movement easier.

name: Negative Pull-Up / Chin-Up
instructions: Get your chin above the pull-up bar using a jump, box, or assistance.
Start from the top position of the pull-up/chin-up.
Slowly lower your body down under control, resisting gravity.
Aim for a slow, controlled descent (e.g., 3-5 seconds or more).
Once arms are fully extended, use assistance to get back to the top.
Focus solely on the lowering (eccentric) phase.
Repeat.
description: Focusing only on the lowering (eccentric) portion of the pull-up/chin-up to build strength.

name: Scapular Pull-Up
instructions: Hang from a pull-up bar with arms fully extended (dead hang).
Keep arms straight throughout the movement.
Depress your shoulder blades, pulling them down and back.
Your body will lift slightly.
Hold the depressed position briefly.
Relax back into the dead hang (scapular elevation).
Focus solely on the movement of the shoulder blades.
Repeat.
description: An activation exercise focusing on shoulder blade depression and elevation while hanging.

name: Archer Pull-Up
instructions: Grab a pull-up bar with a wide overhand grip.
Initiate the pull, focusing on pulling towards one hand.
As you pull up, keep the opposite arm as straight as possible, extending out to the side.
Your body moves diagonally towards the pulling hand.
Lower yourself back down with control.
Alternate sides each rep or complete reps on one side before switching.
Repeat.
description: An advanced pull-up variation emphasizing one arm at a time by keeping the other arm straighter.

name: Typewriter Pull-Up
instructions: Perform a wide grip pull-up until your chin clears the bar.
At the top, keep your chin above the bar and shift your body horizontally towards one hand, partially straightening the opposite arm.
Shift horizontally across to the other hand.
Return to the center and lower down, or perform multiple shifts before lowering.
Maintain height and control during the lateral shift.
Repeat.
description: An advanced pull-up involving pulling up and then shifting laterally side-to-side while staying above the bar.

name: Lat Pulldown (Wide Grip)
instructions: Sit at a lat pulldown machine, adjusting knee pads to secure legs.
Grasp the bar with a wide overhand grip.
Keep torso upright or lean back slightly.
Pull the bar down towards your upper chest by driving elbows down and back.
Squeeze your back muscles at the bottom.
Slowly return the bar to the starting position under control, allowing lats to stretch.
Repeat.
description: A machine exercise mimicking pull-ups, using a wide grip to target lat width.

name: Lat Pulldown (Close Grip - Overhand)
instructions: Sit at a lat pulldown machine.
Grasp the bar with a close overhand grip (hands inside shoulder-width).
Pull the bar down towards your chest, keeping elbows closer to body.
Squeeze back muscles.
Return slowly under control.
Repeat.
description: Lat pulldown using a close overhand grip, changing the angle of pull.

name: Lat Pulldown (Close Grip - Underhand)
instructions: Sit at a lat pulldown machine.
Grasp the bar with a close underhand (supinated) grip.
Pull the bar down towards your chest, driving elbows down and back.
Feel a strong contraction in lats and biceps.
Return slowly under control.
Repeat.
description: Lat pulldown using a close underhand grip, increasing bicep involvement.

name: Lat Pulldown (Neutral Grip)
instructions: Attach a neutral grip handle (palms facing each other) to the lat pulldown machine.
Sit down, securing legs.
Grasp the handles.
Pull the handles down towards your chest, driving elbows down.
Squeeze back muscles.
Return slowly under control.
Repeat.
description: Lat pulldown using a neutral grip attachment.

name: Lat Pulldown (V-Bar)
instructions: Attach a V-bar handle to the lat pulldown machine.
Sit down, securing legs.
Grasp the V-bar.
Pull the handle down towards your upper chest.
Keep elbows relatively tucked.
Squeeze back muscles, focusing on mid-back.
Return slowly under control.
Repeat.
description: Lat pulldown using a V-bar attachment, often emphasizing middle back thickness.

name: Single Arm Lat Pulldown
instructions: Attach a single handle to the lat pulldown machine.
Sit sideways or facing forward.
Grasp the handle with one hand.
Pull the handle down towards your side/chest, focusing on lat contraction.
Allow for torso rotation if desired for deeper contraction.
Control the return.
Complete reps on one side before switching.
Repeat.
description: Performing lat pulldowns one arm at a time for unilateral development and potentially greater range of motion.

name: Behind the Neck Lat Pulldown
instructions: Sit at a lat pulldown machine, grasp bar with wide overhand grip.
Keeping torso very upright, pull the bar down *behind* your head towards the base of your neck.
Requires significant shoulder mobility.
Return slowly.
Use caution: This exercise carries a higher risk of shoulder impingement and is not recommended for many individuals.
Repeat.
description: A lat pulldown variation where the bar is pulled behind the neck. Use extreme caution due to high risk of shoulder injury.

name: Straight-Arm Pulldown (Bar)
instructions: Attach a straight bar to a high cable pulley.
Stand facing the machine, feet shoulder-width apart, slight bend in knees.
Grasp the bar with an overhand grip, arms extended forward/up.
Keeping arms straight (slight elbow bend), pull the bar down towards your thighs in an arc.
Focus on contracting the lats.
Keep torso stable, hinge slightly at hips if needed.
Slowly return the bar to the starting position.
Repeat.
description: An isolation exercise for the lats, performed with straight arms pulling a bar down in an arc.

name: Straight-Arm Pulldown (Rope)
instructions: Attach a rope handle to a high cable pulley.
Grasp rope ends with neutral grip.
Perform the straight-arm pulldown motion, pulling rope down towards thighs.
Can slightly separate rope ends at the bottom.
Return slowly.
Repeat.
description: Performing straight-arm pulldowns using a rope attachment.

name: Dumbbell Pullover (Lat Focus)
instructions: Lie perpendicular across a flat bench, upper back supported, feet flat, hips low.
Hold a single dumbbell with both hands above chest.
Keeping elbows slightly bent, lower the dumbbell backward over your head in an arc.
Focus on feeling a stretch in the lats.
To focus on lats: Initiate the return by pulling with your back muscles, bringing dumbbell back over chest.
Keep hips low.
Repeat.
description: Lowering a dumbbell over the head while across a bench, emphasizing the lats during the pulling phase.

name: Barbell Pullover
instructions: Lie on a flat bench (either along it or across it).
Hold a barbell (straight or EZ bar) with a narrower grip above your chest.
Keeping elbows slightly bent, lower the barbell backward over your head.
Control the movement and feel the stretch.
Pull the barbell back over your chest using lats and/or chest.
Use caution with shoulder mobility.
Repeat.
description: Performing pullovers using a barbell. Requires good shoulder mobility and control.

name: Seated Cable Row (Close Grip)
instructions: Sit at a seated cable row station, feet braced.
Attach a close grip handle (neutral or pronated).
Grasp handle, sit tall with slight knee bend, arms extended.
Pull the handle towards your mid-abdomen, driving elbows back.
Keep torso upright or lean back slightly.
Squeeze shoulder blades together at the peak contraction.
Slowly return the handle to the starting position under control.
Repeat.
description: A fundamental rowing exercise using a close grip handle to target back thickness.

name: Seated Cable Row (Wide Grip)
instructions: Sit at a seated cable row station.
Attach a wide grip bar.
Grasp bar with wide overhand grip.
Pull the bar towards your upper abdomen/lower chest, keeping elbows flared out wider.
Squeeze upper back muscles.
Return slowly.
Repeat.
description: Seated cable row using a wide grip, targeting the upper back muscles more.

name: Seated Cable Row (V-Bar)
instructions: Sit at a seated cable row station.
Attach a V-bar handle.
Grasp V-bar.
Pull handle towards mid-abdomen, keeping elbows tucked.
Squeeze shoulder blades.
Return slowly.
Repeat.
description: Seated cable row using a V-bar attachment, similar to close grip.

name: Seated Cable Row (Single Arm)
instructions: Sit at a seated cable row station.
Attach a single handle.
Grasp handle with one hand.
Pull handle towards your side/abdomen, driving elbow back.
Allow slight torso rotation for greater contraction.
Squeeze back muscles.
Return slowly.
Complete reps on one side before switching.
Repeat.
description: Performing seated rows one arm at a time for unilateral focus and potential increased range of motion.

name: Seated Cable Row (Rope - Face Pull)
instructions: Sit at a seated cable row station.
Attach a rope handle.
Grasp rope ends, palms facing each other.
Pull the rope towards your face/upper chest, driving elbows high and wide.
Externally rotate shoulders at the end (like a face pull).
Squeeze upper back and rear delts.
Return slowly.
Repeat.
description: A seated row variation using a rope pulled towards the face, similar to a face pull, targeting upper back and rear delts.

name: Machine Row (Chest Supported)
instructions: Adjust seat height on a chest-supported row machine so chest pad is comfortable.
Sit facing the machine, chest firmly against the pad.
Grasp handles with desired grip (neutral, pronated, supinated).
Pull handles towards your body by retracting shoulder blades and driving elbows back.
Squeeze back muscles.
Return slowly until arms are extended.
Repeat.
description: Performing rows on a machine with chest support, providing stability and isolating back muscles.

name: Hammer Strength Iso-Lateral Row
instructions: Sit in the Hammer Strength row machine, adjusting seat height.
Grasp handles (often allows independent arm movement).
Pull handles towards body, squeezing back.
Can pull both arms simultaneously or alternate.
Return slowly.
Repeat.
description: A popular chest-supported machine row allowing independent (iso-lateral) arm movement.

name: T-Bar Row (Chest Supported)
instructions: Position yourself on a chest-supported T-bar row machine.
Grasp handles with desired grip.
Pull the handles towards your chest by retracting shoulder blades and driving elbows back.
Squeeze back muscles.
Lower weight slowly.
Repeat.
description: Performing rows using a T-bar apparatus with chest support.

name: T-Bar Row (Landmine Style)
instructions: Place one end of barbell in landmine attachment.
Load other end with weight.
Straddle the barbell.
Attach a V-handle or other handle under the bar (or grip bar itself).
Hinge at hips, keeping back flat (similar to bent-over row stance).
Pull the bar towards your chest, driving elbows back.
Squeeze back muscles.
Lower weight slowly under control.
Repeat.
description: Performing T-bar rows using a barbell anchored in a landmine attachment, requiring more core stabilization.

name: Barbell Bent-Over Row (Overhand)
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
Grasp barbell with overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Hinge at hips, keeping back flat, until torso is near parallel to floor (or slightly higher).
Let bar hang with arms extended.
Pull the barbell towards your upper abdomen/lower chest.
Drive elbows up and back, squeeze shoulder blades.
Lower bar slowly under control.
Repeat.
description: A classic free-weight rowing exercise targeting the back using an overhand grip.

name: Barbell Bent-Over Row (Underhand - Yates)
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart.
Grasp barbell with underhand (supinated) grip, shoulder-width apart.
Hinge at hips, keeping back flat, but maintain a more upright torso angle (e.g., 45-70 degrees) compared to overhand rows.
Pull the barbell towards your lower abdomen/hip crease.
Keep elbows tucked closer to body.
Lower bar slowly.
Repeat.
description: A bent-over row variation using an underhand grip and a more upright torso (popularized by Dorian Yates).

name: Pendlay Row
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, barbell on the floor.
Hinge at hips, keeping back flat and parallel to the floor.
Grasp barbell with overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Explosively pull the barbell off the floor towards your lower chest/upper abdomen.
Keep torso angle constant (minimal body english).
Lower the bar back to the floor under control (dead stop between reps).
Reset and repeat.
description: A strict barbell row variation performed with the back parallel to the floor, pulling from a dead stop each rep.

name: Dumbbell Bent-Over Row
instructions: Stand holding dumbbells, feet shoulder-width apart.
Hinge at hips, keeping back flat, torso near parallel to floor.
Let dumbbells hang, palms facing each other or body.
Pull dumbbells towards your torso, driving elbows back.
Squeeze shoulder blades.
Lower slowly.
Repeat.
description: Performing bent-over rows using dumbbells.

name: Single-Arm Dumbbell Row
instructions: Place one knee and the same-side hand on a flat bench.
Keep back flat, parallel to floor.
Plant the opposite foot firmly on the floor.
Hold a dumbbell in the free hand, arm extended.
Pull the dumbbell upwards towards your hip/side.
Drive elbow back, squeeze lat and back muscles.
Lower slowly under control.
Complete reps on one side before switching.
Repeat.
description: A fundamental unilateral rowing exercise performed with one knee and hand supporting on a bench.

name: Kroc Row
instructions: Similar setup to single-arm dumbbell row, but typically performed with very heavy weight for high reps.
Use significant but controlled body english/momentum to lift the heavy dumbbell.
Focus on pulling hard and getting a good stretch at the bottom.
Often performed for one high-rep set per side.
Requires strong grip.
Repeat on other side.
description: A high-repetition, heavy single-arm dumbbell row variation emphasizing overload and grip strength, allowing some momentum.

name: Seal Row
instructions: Lie face down on an elevated flat bench (high enough for arms to hang straight with weight).
Hold a barbell or dumbbells.
Keep chest supported on the bench.
Pull the weight upwards towards the bench by retracting shoulder blades and driving elbows back.
Squeeze back muscles.
Lower slowly under control.
Removes lower back strain and isolates upper back.
Repeat.
description: A rowing exercise performed lying face down on an elevated bench, strictly isolating the upper back muscles.

name: Inverted Row / Australian Pull-Up
instructions: Set a bar in a rack or use Smith machine/suspension trainer handles at waist height or lower.
Position yourself underneath the bar/handles, lying face up.
Grasp bar/handles with overhand or underhand grip, shoulder-width apart.
Keep body straight from head to heels (like a plank), heels on floor.
Pull your chest towards the bar/handles by retracting shoulder blades and pulling with arms.
Lower slowly under control.
Adjust bar height or foot position to change difficulty (straighter legs/lower bar = harder).
Repeat.
description: A bodyweight rowing exercise performed hanging underneath a bar or rings, pulling the chest towards the anchor point.

name: Feet Elevated Inverted Row
instructions: Set up for an inverted row.
Elevate your feet onto a bench or box.
Keep body straight.
Pull your chest towards the bar/handles.
Lower slowly.
Elevating feet increases the percentage of bodyweight lifted, making it harder.
Repeat.
description: An inverted row variation with feet elevated on a surface, increasing the difficulty.

name: Ring Rows
instructions: Set gymnastic rings to appropriate height.
Grasp rings, position body underneath similar to inverted row.
Keep body straight.
Pull chest towards the rings.
Rings allow natural wrist rotation and require more stabilization.
Lower slowly.
Adjust foot position/body angle for difficulty.
Repeat.
description: Performing inverted rows using gymnastic rings, increasing stability demands.

name: Face Pull (Upper Back Focus)
instructions: Set cable pulley at chest/head height with rope handle.
Grip rope, step back.
Pull rope towards face, driving elbows high and wide.
Focus on intensely squeezing shoulder blades together at the end range.
Emphasize the retraction and upper back contraction over rear delt isolation.
Return slowly.
Repeat.
description: Face pulls performed with specific intent to maximize upper back muscle contraction (traps, rhomboids).

name: Band Face Pull
instructions: Anchor resistance band at chest/head height.
Grip band, step back.
Pull band towards face, elbows high and wide, externally rotate.
Squeeze upper back.
Return slowly.
Repeat.
description: Face pulls using a resistance band.

name: Band Pull-Apart
instructions: Hold a resistance band with both hands, shoulder-width apart, palms down or up.
Extend arms straight in front at chest height.
Keeping arms straight (slight elbow bend), pull the band apart horizontally.
Focus on squeezing shoulder blades together.
Return slowly to the starting position.
Repeat.
description: An exercise using a resistance band to strengthen the upper back muscles involved in scapular retraction.

name: Barbell Shrug
instructions: Stand holding a barbell in front of your thighs with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
Keep arms straight.
Elevate your shoulders straight up towards your ears.
Focus on squeezing the trapezius muscles.
Hold the contraction briefly.
Lower the shoulders back down slowly.
Avoid rolling shoulders.
Repeat.
description: A trap isolation exercise involving elevating the shoulders against barbell resistance.

name: Dumbbell Shrug
instructions: Stand holding dumbbells at your sides, palms facing your body.
Keep arms straight.
Elevate your shoulders straight up towards your ears.
Squeeze traps.
Hold briefly.
Lower slowly.
Repeat.
description: Performing shrugs holding dumbbells at the sides.

name: Machine Shrug
instructions: Position yourself in a shrug machine (seated or standing).
Grip handles or place shoulders under pads.
Keeping arms straight, elevate shoulders upwards.
Squeeze traps.
Lower slowly.
Repeat.
description: Using a dedicated machine to perform shrugs.

name: Cable Shrug
instructions: Set a cable pulley to the lowest position.
Attach a straight bar or individual handles.
Stand facing machine, grip attachment.
Keeping arms straight, elevate shoulders upwards.
Squeeze traps.
Lower slowly.
Repeat.
description: Performing shrugs using a cable machine for constant tension.

name: Behind the Back Barbell Shrug
instructions: Stand holding a barbell *behind* your glutes with an overhand grip.
Keep arms straight.
Elevate shoulders straight up towards ears.
Squeeze traps.
Lower slowly.
This variation may allow better trap activation for some.
Repeat.
description: Barbell shrugs performed with the bar held behind the body.

name: Upright Row (Trap Focus)
instructions: Perform upright rows (Barbell, DB, or Cable) as described previously (ID 260, 261, 262).
Focus mentally on elevating the shoulders and squeezing the upper trapezius muscles throughout the movement, especially at the top.
May use slightly more 'shrugging' motion than when focusing purely on deltoids.
Use caution for shoulder health.
Repeat.
description: Performing upright rows with the primary intention of targeting the upper trapezius muscles.

name: High Row (Upper Back Focus)
instructions: Perform high rows (Cable, DB, Machine) as described previously (ID 259).
Focus on pulling with the upper back musculature (rhomboids, mid-traps) and rear deltoids.
Ensure a strong squeeze between the shoulder blades at the peak contraction.
Control the eccentric phase.
Repeat.
description: Performing high rows with the primary intention of targeting the muscles of the upper back (rhomboids, traps).

name: Good Morning (Back Erector Focus)
instructions: Perform Good Mornings (Barbell, Band, Seated) as described previously (ID 126, 127, 128).
Maintain a strict, flat back throughout the movement.
Focus on controlling the hinge using the lower back muscles (spinal erectors).
Avoid excessive rounding.
Feel the erectors working isometrically during the hinge and concentrically during the return to standing.
Use appropriate weight.
Repeat.
description: Performing the Good Morning exercise with emphasis on strengthening the spinal erector muscles.

name: Hyperextension / Back Extension
instructions: Position yourself on a hyperextension bench (45-degree or horizontal).
Secure ankles under pads.
Align hip crease with edge of thigh pad.
Cross arms over chest or place hands behind head.
Lower torso by hinging at the hips, keeping back straight.
Lift torso back up until body forms a straight line.
Focus on using lower back muscles (and glutes/hamstrings).
Avoid excessive hyperextension at the top.
Can hold weight plate for added resistance.
Repeat.
description: An exercise targeting the lower back (spinal erectors), glutes, and hamstrings using a hyperextension bench.

name: Reverse Hyperextension
instructions: Position face down on reverse hyper machine, hips at edge, torso supported.
Grip handles.
Legs hang down (add weight if applicable).
Lift legs by extending hips, contracting glutes and hamstrings.
Keep legs straight or slightly bent.
Lift until legs are about in line with torso.
Lower slowly.
Repeat.
description: Targeting the posterior chain (glutes, hamstrings, lower back) by lifting the legs while torso is stationary.

name: Barbell Curl
instructions: Stand tall, feet shoulder-width apart.
Hold a barbell (straight or EZ bar) with an underhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
Keep elbows tucked close to your sides.
Curl the barbell upwards towards your shoulders by contracting your biceps.
Keep upper arms stationary; only forearms should move.
Squeeze biceps at the top.
Lower the barbell slowly under control until arms are fully extended.
Avoid swinging.
Repeat.
description: A fundamental bicep exercise using a barbell.

name: Standing Dumbbell Curl
instructions: Stand tall holding dumbbells at your sides, palms facing forward (supinated) or sides (neutral - hammer curl start).
Keep elbows tucked.
Curl dumbbells upwards towards shoulders.
If starting neutral, supinate (rotate palms up) as you curl.
Squeeze biceps at the top.
Lower slowly under control.
Can curl both arms simultaneously or alternate.
Repeat.
description: Performing bicep curls while standing using dumbbells.

name: Seated Dumbbell Curl
instructions: Sit on a bench (with or without back support).
Hold dumbbells at your sides, palms facing forward or sides.
Keep elbows tucked.
Curl dumbbells upwards towards shoulders, supinating if starting neutral.
Squeeze biceps.
Lower slowly.
Seated position helps reduce momentum/swinging.
Can alternate or curl both arms.
Repeat.
description: Performing dumbbell bicep curls while seated to minimize body swing.

name: Incline Dumbbell Curl
instructions: Sit on an incline bench (e.g., 45-60 degrees).
Let arms hang straight down holding dumbbells, palms facing forward or each other.
Keep upper arms stationary, perpendicular to the floor.
Curl dumbbells upwards towards shoulders, keeping elbows pointing down.
Squeeze biceps at the top.
Lower slowly under control, feeling the stretch at the bottom.
Repeat.
description: Dumbbell curls performed on an incline bench, increasing the stretch on the biceps long head.

name: Hammer Curl
instructions: Stand or sit holding dumbbells at your sides, palms facing your body (neutral grip).
Keep elbows tucked.
Curl dumbbells upwards towards shoulders, maintaining the neutral grip throughout.
Keep upper arms stationary.
Squeeze at the top.
Lower slowly.
Targets brachialis and brachioradialis muscles in addition to biceps.
Repeat.
description: A dumbbell curl variation using a neutral (palms facing) grip, targeting the brachialis and forearm muscles.

name: Rope Hammer Curl
instructions: Attach a rope handle to a low cable pulley.
Stand facing machine, grab rope ends with neutral grip.
Keep elbows tucked.
Curl rope upwards towards shoulders, maintaining neutral grip.
Squeeze at the top.
Lower slowly.
Repeat.
description: Performing hammer curls using a cable and rope attachment.

name: Cross Body Hammer Curl
instructions: Stand or sit holding dumbbells with neutral grip.
Curl one dumbbell upwards and across your body towards the opposite shoulder.
Maintain neutral grip.
Lower slowly.
Alternate arms.
Repeat.
description: A hammer curl variation where the dumbbell is curled across the body towards the opposite shoulder.

name: Concentration Curl
instructions: Sit on a bench, lean forward slightly.
Place the back of your upper arm (tricep area) against your inner thigh.
Hold a dumbbell with arm extended.
Curl the dumbbell upwards towards your shoulder.
Keep upper arm braced against thigh; only forearm moves.
Focus on isolating the bicep and squeezing at the top.
Lower slowly.
Complete reps on one side before switching.
Repeat.
description: A strict bicep isolation exercise performed seated with the upper arm braced against the inner thigh.

name: Preacher Curl (Barbell)
instructions: Sit at a preacher curl bench, adjusting seat height so armpits are near the top of the pad.
Rest the back of your upper arms firmly against the pad.
Hold a barbell (EZ or straight) with an underhand grip.
Start with arms almost fully extended.
Curl the bar upwards towards your shoulders.
Keep upper arms pressed against pad.
Squeeze biceps at the top.
Lower slowly under control until arms are nearly straight.
Repeat.
description: Bicep curls performed with upper arms supported on a preacher bench pad, isolating the biceps.

name: Preacher Curl (Dumbbell)
instructions: Sit at preacher curl bench.
Rest back of upper arm(s) against pad.
Hold dumbbell(s) with underhand grip.
Curl dumbbell(s) upwards.
Squeeze biceps.
Lower slowly.
Can be done one arm or two arms.
Repeat.
description: Performing preacher curls with dumbbells, allowing for unilateral work.

name: Machine Preacher Curl
instructions: Sit in a preacher curl machine, adjust seat.
Rest back of upper arms against pad.
Grip handles (usually underhand position).
Curl handles upwards by contracting biceps.
Squeeze at the top.
Lower slowly under control.
Repeat.
description: Using a dedicated machine to perform preacher curls.

name: Cable Curl (Straight Bar)
instructions: Attach a straight bar to a low cable pulley.
Stand facing machine, grab bar with underhand grip.
Keep elbows tucked.
Curl bar upwards towards shoulders.
Squeeze biceps.
Lower slowly.
Cable provides constant tension.
Repeat.
description: Performing bicep curls using a cable machine and straight bar attachment.

name: Cable Curl (EZ Bar)
instructions: Attach an EZ bar to a low cable pulley.
Grab bar with underhand grip on angled sections.
Keep elbows tucked.
Curl bar upwards.
Squeeze biceps.
Lower slowly.
Repeat.
description: Performing cable curls with an EZ bar attachment for a more comfortable wrist angle.

name: Cable Curl (Rope)
instructions: Attach a rope handle to a low cable pulley.
Grab rope ends with neutral grip.
Keep elbows tucked.
Curl rope upwards towards shoulders.
Can keep neutral grip or supinate slightly at the top.
Squeeze biceps.
Lower slowly.
Repeat.
description: Performing cable curls with a rope attachment, often used for hammer curls or allowing supination.

name: Single Arm Cable Curl
instructions: Attach a single handle to a low cable pulley.
Stand facing machine (or sideways).
Grab handle with one hand, underhand grip.
Keep elbow tucked.
Curl handle upwards.
Squeeze bicep.
Lower slowly.
Complete reps on one side before switching.
Repeat.
description: Performing cable curls one arm at a time.

name: High Cable Curl / Overhead Cable Curl
instructions: Set two cable pulleys to a high position (above head height).
Attach single handles.
Stand in the center, grab handles (underhand or neutral grip).
Extend arms out to sides (like a T-pose).
Keeping upper arms stationary and parallel to floor, curl handles towards your ears.
Squeeze biceps.
Slowly return to starting position.
Repeat.
description: A bicep curl variation performed with arms abducted using high cables, often targeting the short head.

name: Reverse Barbell Curl
instructions: Stand tall holding a barbell (straight or EZ bar) with an overhand (pronated) grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
Keep elbows tucked.
Curl the bar upwards towards shoulders, maintaining the overhand grip.
Focus on using forearm and brachialis muscles.
Lower slowly under control.
Repeat.
description: A curl variation using an overhand grip to target the brachioradialis and forearm extensor muscles.

name: Reverse Dumbbell Curl
instructions: Stand or sit holding dumbbells with an overhand grip, palms facing body/down.
Keep elbows tucked.
Curl dumbbells upwards towards shoulders, maintaining pronated grip.
Lower slowly.
Repeat.
description: Performing reverse curls using dumbbells.

name: Spider Curl
instructions: Set an incline bench to 45-60 degrees.
Lie face down on the bench, chest supported, arms hanging straight down.
Hold dumbbells or a barbell with an underhand grip.
Keeping upper arms vertical and stationary, curl the weight upwards.
Focus on isolating the biceps.
Squeeze at the top.
Lower slowly under control.
Repeat.
description: Bicep curls performed lying face down on an incline bench, isolating the biceps by preventing body swing.

name: Zottman Curl
instructions: Stand or sit holding dumbbells, palms facing forward (supinated).
Curl the dumbbells upwards like a standard curl.
At the top, rotate your wrists so palms face downwards (pronated).
Lower the dumbbells slowly with the palms-down grip.
At the bottom, rotate wrists back to palms-up.
Repeat the sequence.
Combines standard curl concentric with reverse curl eccentric.
description: A curl combining a standard concentric (palms up) with a reverse grip eccentric (palms down).

name: Drag Curl
instructions: Stand holding barbell or dumbbells with underhand grip.
Instead of curling in an arc, pull elbows backward, 'dragging' the bar/dumbbells up along your torso.
Keep weight close to body.
Focus on peak contraction at the top.
Lower by reversing the path.
Eliminates front deltoid involvement.
Repeat.
description: A bicep curl variation where the weight is dragged up the torso by pulling elbows back, emphasizing peak contraction.

name: Waiter's Curl
instructions: Hold a single dumbbell vertically with both hands flat underneath the top end (like carrying a tray).
Stand tall, elbows tucked.
Curl the dumbbell upwards towards your chest, keeping hands flat.
Focus on bicep contraction.
Lower slowly.
Repeat.
description: A bicep curl performed holding a dumbbell vertically with open palms underneath.

name: Barbell Wrist Curl (Palms Up)
instructions: Sit on a bench, forearms resting on thighs or bench edge, wrists hanging off.
Hold a barbell with an underhand grip (palms up).
Let the barbell roll down towards your fingertips slightly (optional).
Curl the barbell upwards by flexing only your wrists.
Squeeze forearm flexors.
Lower slowly back down.
Repeat.
description: An isolation exercise for the forearm flexor muscles using a barbell and wrist flexion.

name: Dumbbell Wrist Curl (Palms Up)
instructions: Sit holding dumbbells, forearms resting on thighs or bench, palms facing up.
Curl dumbbells upwards by flexing wrists.
Squeeze.
Lower slowly.
Repeat.
description: Performing wrist curls with dumbbells, palms facing up.

name: Barbell Reverse Wrist Curl
instructions: Sit on bench, forearms resting on thighs/bench, wrists hanging off.
Hold barbell with overhand grip (palms down).
Extend your wrists upwards, lifting the back of your hands towards the ceiling.
Squeeze forearm extensors.
Lower slowly.
Repeat.
description: An isolation exercise for the forearm extensor muscles using a barbell and wrist extension.

name: Dumbbell Reverse Wrist Curl
instructions: Sit holding dumbbells, forearms resting on thighs/bench, palms facing down.
Extend wrists upwards.
Squeeze.
Lower slowly.
Repeat.
description: Performing reverse wrist curls with dumbbells, palms facing down.

name: Behind the Back Wrist Curl
instructions: Stand holding a barbell behind your glutes with an underhand grip (palms facing back).
Let the bar hang.
Curl the barbell upwards by flexing only your wrists.
Squeeze forearm flexors.
Lower slowly.
Repeat.
description: Performing wrist curls with the barbell held behind the back.

name: Forearm Plank
instructions: Place forearms on the ground, elbows directly under shoulders, hands clasped or flat.
Extend legs back, resting on toes.
Engage core, glutes, and quads to form a straight line from head to heels.
Avoid letting hips sag or rise too high.
Keep neck in line with spine.
Hold the position for the desired duration.
description: A fundamental isometric core exercise performed on the forearms to build abdominal strength and stability.

name: High Plank
instructions: Place hands on the ground directly under shoulders, arms straight.
Extend legs back, resting on toes.
Engage core, glutes, and quads to form a straight line from head to heels.
Avoid letting hips sag or rise too high.
Keep neck in line with spine, looking slightly forward.
Hold the position for the desired duration.
description: An isometric core exercise performed on the hands (push-up position) to build core strength and shoulder stability.

name: Side Plank (Right)
instructions: Lie on your right side, legs straight, feet stacked or staggered.
Place your right forearm on the floor, elbow directly under your shoulder (or place right hand directly under shoulder for high side plank).
Engage your core and lift your hips off the floor until your body forms a straight line from head to feet.
Keep hips square and avoid rotating.
Place left hand on hip or extend it towards the ceiling.
Hold the position for the desired duration.
Lower hips slowly.
description: An isometric exercise targeting the right oblique muscles and core stability by supporting the body on the right side.

name: Side Plank (Left)
instructions: Lie on your left side, legs straight, feet stacked or staggered.
Place your left forearm on the floor, elbow directly under your shoulder (or place left hand directly under shoulder for high side plank).
Engage your core and lift your hips off the floor until your body forms a straight line from head to feet.
Keep hips square and avoid rotating.
Place right hand on hip or extend it towards the ceiling.
Hold the position for the desired duration.
Lower hips slowly.
description: An isometric exercise targeting the left oblique muscles and core stability by supporting the body on the left side.

name: Plank Jacks
instructions: Start in a high plank position (on hands), body straight.
Keeping your core engaged and upper body stable, jump your feet out wide.
Immediately jump your feet back together to the starting position.
Maintain a steady plank height; avoid letting hips bounce up and down excessively.
Continue the jumping jack motion with your legs.
Repeat for reps or time.
description: A dynamic plank variation combining a plank hold with jumping jack leg movements for core stability and cardio.

name: Plank Shoulder Taps
instructions: Start in a high plank position, feet slightly wider than hip-width for stability.
Keep your body straight and core tightly braced.
Minimize hip rotation.
Lift one hand off the floor and tap the opposite shoulder.
Place the hand back down.
Lift the other hand and tap the opposite shoulder.
Continue alternating taps slowly and with control.
Focus on keeping hips square to the floor.
Repeat.
description: A plank variation involving tapping opposite shoulders, challenging core stability and anti-rotation.

name: Plank Leg Lifts
instructions: Start in a forearm or high plank position.
Keep core engaged and body straight.
Maintaining stability, lift one leg straight up off the floor a few inches.
Keep the leg straight and avoid arching the lower back.
Focus on using the glute to lift the leg.
Hold briefly.
Lower the leg back down under control.
Alternate legs.
Repeat.
description: A plank variation challenging core stability by alternately lifting one leg off the floor.

name: Plank Arm Lifts
instructions: Start in a forearm or high plank position, feet wider for stability.
Keep core braced and body stable.
Slowly lift one arm straight forward off the floor, reaching it out in line with your body.
Avoid letting hips twist or sag.
Hold briefly.
Lower the arm back down under control.
Alternate arms.
Repeat.
description: A plank variation challenging core stability and shoulder strength by alternately lifting one arm off the floor.

name: Plank Reach
instructions: Start in a forearm or high plank position.
Maintain a stable core and body line.
Reach one arm straight forward, extending it fully.
Hold briefly.
Return the arm to the starting position.
Reach the other arm straight forward.
Continue alternating arm reaches.
Repeat.
description: Similar to plank arm lifts, focusing on reaching one arm forward while maintaining plank stability.

name: Body Saw
instructions: Place feet on sliders or a towel on a smooth floor.
Assume a forearm plank position.
Keeping core tight and body straight, use your arms/shoulders to push your body backward, sliding your feet away.
Slide back as far as you can maintain control and a straight body line.
Pull your body forward back to the starting plank position using your arms and lats.
Repeat the sawing motion back and forth.
Repeat.
description: A dynamic plank variation using sliders under the feet to move the body forward and backward, intensely challenging the core.

name: RKC Plank
instructions: Assume a forearm plank position, elbows slightly closer together and further forward than standard plank.
Clench fists tightly.
Intensely contract *every* muscle in your body: glutes squeezed hard, quads tight, core braced maximally, lats engaged (pulling shoulders down).
Try to pull your elbows towards your toes and toes towards your elbows isometrically.
Maintain maximum tension throughout the hold.
Hold for shorter durations (e.g., 10-20 seconds) due to high intensity.
Repeat.
description: A high-tension plank variation focusing on maximal full-body muscle contraction for a short duration.

name: Extended Plank
instructions: Start in a forearm or high plank position.
Walk your hands or forearms forward, extending them further out in front of your shoulders.
Maintain a straight body line from shoulders to heels.
The further forward your arms, the greater the lever and challenge on the core.
Hold the extended position.
Avoid letting hips sag.
Repeat.
description: A plank variation where the arms are positioned further forward, increasing the demand on the core.

name: Side Plank Hip Dips
instructions: Start in a side plank position (forearm or hand).
Maintain a straight body line.
Slowly lower your bottom hip towards the floor without touching.
Lift the hip back up to the starting position, squeezing the bottom oblique.
Continue dipping and lifting the hip with control.
Complete reps on one side before switching.
Repeat.
description: A dynamic side plank variation involving dipping the hips towards the floor and lifting back up.

name: Side Plank Rotation
instructions: Start in a side plank position (forearm or hand), top arm extended towards the ceiling.
Slowly rotate your torso downwards.
Reach your top arm underneath your body ('thread the needle').
Rotate back to the starting side plank position, reaching the top arm back up.
Control the rotation.
Complete reps on one side before switching.
Repeat.
description: A dynamic side plank involving rotating the torso and reaching the top arm underneath the body.

name: Bird Dog
instructions: Start on hands and knees, hands under shoulders, knees under hips.
Keep back flat, core engaged.
Simultaneously extend your right arm straight forward and your left leg straight back.
Keep hips and shoulders square to the floor; avoid rotation.
Reach long through fingertips and heel.
Hold briefly.
Return slowly to start.
Repeat with left arm and right leg.
Continue alternating.
Repeat.
description: A core stability exercise improving balance and control by extending opposite arm and leg.

name: Dead Bug
instructions: Lie on your back, arms extended towards ceiling.
Bring knees up, hips and knees bent at 90 degrees (tabletop).
Engage core, press lower back gently into floor.
Slowly lower your right arm back towards floor while simultaneously extending your left leg straight out.
Lower as far as you can maintain lower back contact with floor.
Return slowly to start.
Repeat with left arm and right leg.
Continue alternating slowly and with control.
Repeat.
description: A core exercise focusing on lumbo-pelvic stability by coordinating opposite limb movements while lying supine.

name: Resisted Dead Bug
instructions: Anchor a resistance band low behind you (or have partner hold).
Lie on back in dead bug starting position (arms up, legs tabletop).
Hold the band handles/ends in your hands.
Perform the dead bug movement as normal (lower opposite arm/leg).
The band adds resistance to the arm lowering phase.
Maintain core control and lower back contact.
Alternate sides.
Repeat.
description: The dead bug exercise performed with added resistance from a band pulling against the arms.

name: Crunches
instructions: Lie on your back, knees bent, feet flat on floor.
Place hands lightly behind head (don't pull on neck) or across chest.
Engage abs and lift your head, shoulders, and upper back off the floor.
Focus on curling your rib cage towards your pelvis.
Keep lower back pressed into floor.
Hold the contraction briefly.
Lower slowly back down.
Repeat.
description: A basic abdominal exercise involving curling the upper body off the floor.

name: Bicycle Crunches
instructions: Lie on your back, hands lightly behind head.
Lift shoulders off floor, bring knees towards chest.
Bring your right elbow towards your left knee while simultaneously extending your right leg straight out.
Alternate sides, bringing left elbow towards right knee while extending left leg.
Create a cycling motion with legs and twisting motion with torso.
Keep core engaged and lower back close to floor.
Repeat.
description: A dynamic core exercise combining a crunch, twist, and leg cycling motion, targeting abs and obliques.

name: Reverse Crunches
instructions: Lie on your back, knees bent at 90 degrees, shins parallel to floor (tabletop).
Place hands by sides, palms down, or lightly behind head.
Engage your lower abs to curl your hips off the floor, bringing knees towards your chest.
Lift hips slightly.
Lower hips back down slowly and with control.
Avoid using momentum or swinging legs.
Repeat.
description: An abdominal exercise focusing on the lower abs by curling the hips off the floor.

name: Heel Touches
instructions: Lie on back, knees bent, feet flat on floor close to glutes.
Arms extended by sides.
Lift head and shoulders slightly off floor.
Reach one hand towards the heel on the same side, crunching the oblique.
Return to center.
Reach the other hand towards the other heel.
Continue alternating side bends.
Repeat.
description: A core exercise targeting the obliques by reaching side-to-side towards the heels while lying supine.

name: Oblique Crunches (Lying)
instructions: Lie on your back, knees bent, feet flat.
Drop both knees to one side (e.g., right).
Place hands behind head or across chest.
Perform a crunch, lifting shoulders straight up towards ceiling or slightly towards the upper hip.
Focus on contracting the top oblique.
Lower slowly.
Complete reps on one side before switching knee position.
Repeat.
description: A crunch variation targeting the obliques by dropping the knees to one side.

name: Cable Crunch
instructions: Attach a rope or handle attachment to a high cable pulley.
Kneel facing the machine, a few feet back.
Grasp the rope/handles and pull them down so hands are near your forehead/neck.
Keeping hips stationary, crunch forward by flexing your spine.
Bring your elbows towards your knees.
Focus on contracting your abs.
Hold the contraction.
Slowly return to the starting position, resisting the weight.
Repeat.
description: Performing crunches against cable resistance while kneeling.

name: Machine Crunch
instructions: Sit in an abdominal crunch machine, adjusting seat/pads.
Place feet under pads or flat on floor.
Grip handles or place arms on pads as indicated.
Crunch forward by flexing your spine against the machine's resistance.
Contract abs fully.
Return slowly to start.
Repeat.
description: Using a dedicated machine to perform crunches with guided resistance.

name: Decline Crunch
instructions: Lie on a decline bench, securing legs under pads.
Place hands behind head or across chest.
Perform a crunch, lifting head and shoulders off the bench.
Focus on abs contraction.
Lower slowly.
The decline angle increases resistance.
Repeat.
description: Performing crunches on a decline bench to increase the range of motion and difficulty.

name: Weighted Crunch
instructions: Lie on your back (flat or decline), knees bent, feet flat.
Hold a weight plate or dumbbell on your chest or behind your head.
Perform a crunch, lifting head and shoulders.
The added weight increases resistance.
Lower slowly.
Repeat.
description: Performing crunches while holding additional weight for increased resistance.

name: Leg Raises (Lying)
instructions: Lie flat on your back, legs straight or slightly bent.
Place hands under lower back for support or by sides.
Keep lower back pressed into floor.
Engage lower abs and lift legs straight up towards the ceiling until perpendicular to floor (or keep knees bent and lift).
Lower legs back down slowly and under control, stopping just before they touch floor.
Avoid letting lower back arch off floor.
Repeat.
description: Lying on the back and lifting the legs upwards, primarily targeting the lower abdominals and hip flexors.

name: Hanging Leg Raises
instructions: Hang from a pull-up bar with arms fully extended, grip stable.
Engage core.
Keeping legs straight (or knees bent for easier version), raise your legs upwards.
Aim to bring legs parallel to floor (or higher if possible), or knees towards chest.
Control the movement, avoid swinging.
Lower legs slowly back down.
Repeat.
description: Lifting the legs while hanging from a bar, challenging the lower abs, hip flexors, and grip strength.

name: Hanging Knee Raises / Tucks
instructions: Hang from a pull-up bar.
Engage core.
Bend your knees and lift them upwards towards your chest.
Focus on curling your pelvis slightly at the top.
Control the movement, minimize swinging.
Lower knees back down slowly.
Repeat.
description: Lifting bent knees towards the chest while hanging from a bar, a slightly easier variation than straight leg raises.

name: Captain's Chair Leg/Knee Raise
instructions: Position yourself in a captain's chair apparatus, back supported, forearms resting on pads.
Grip handles lightly.
Let legs hang straight down.
Engage core.
Raise legs straight up (harder) or bend knees and raise them towards chest (easier).
Focus on using lower abs.
Lower legs slowly under control.
Avoid swinging.
Repeat.
description: Performing leg or knee raises using a captain's chair, providing back and arm support.

name: Flutter Kicks
instructions: Lie flat on your back, legs straight.
Place hands under lower back for support.
Lift head and shoulders slightly off floor (optional).
Engage core, keep lower back pressed down.
Keeping legs straight, lift feet slightly off floor.
Perform small, alternating up-and-down kicking motions (like swimming flutter kick).
Keep kicks controlled and from the hip.
Continue for reps or time.
description: An abdominal exercise involving small, alternating leg kicks while lying supine.

name: Scissor Kicks
instructions: Lie flat on your back, legs straight.
Place hands under lower back for support.
Lift head and shoulders slightly off floor (optional).
Engage core, keep lower back pressed down.
Keeping legs straight, lift feet slightly off floor.
Perform alternating side-to-side crossing motions with your legs (like scissors).
Alternate which leg crosses over the top.
Keep movements controlled.
Continue for reps or time.
description: An abdominal exercise involving crossing legs side-to-side in a scissor-like motion while lying supine.

name: Hollow Hold
instructions: Lie flat on your back.
Engage core deeply, pressing lower back firmly into the floor (posterior pelvic tilt).
Simultaneously lift head, shoulders, and legs slightly off the floor.
Extend arms overhead or keep by sides.
Maintain the 'hollow' C-shape with your body.
Ensure lower back stays glued to the floor.
Hold this isometric position.
Modify by bending knees or raising arms/legs higher if needed.
Hold for time.
description: An isometric core exercise focused on maintaining lower back contact with the floor while limbs are lifted, building deep core strength.

name: Hollow Rock
instructions: Assume the hollow body hold position.
Initiate a gentle rocking motion back and forth from shoulders to hips.
Maintain the hollow body shape and core tension throughout the rock.
Movement should be smooth and controlled, not jerky.
Keep lower back pressed into floor.
Rock for reps or time.
description: A dynamic version of the hollow hold, involving rocking back and forth while maintaining the hollow body position.

name: V-Ups
instructions: Lie flat on your back, arms extended overhead, legs straight.
Simultaneously lift your torso and straight legs upwards, reaching your hands towards your toes.
Form a 'V' shape with your body at the top.
Keep core engaged.
Lower back down slowly and with control.
Repeat.
description: A challenging abdominal exercise involving lifting both the torso and straight legs simultaneously to form a V-shape.

name: Tuck-Ups
instructions: Lie flat on your back, arms extended overhead, legs straight.
Simultaneously lift your torso and bend your knees, bringing knees towards your chest.
Try to touch knees with elbows or hands.
Lower back down slowly.
Easier variation of V-ups.
Repeat.
description: An abdominal exercise similar to V-Ups but performed with bent knees (tucking), making it slightly easier.

name: Sit-ups
instructions: Lie on your back, knees bent, feet flat on floor (can anchor feet if needed).
Place hands behind head or across chest.
Engage core and lift entire torso off the floor towards your knees.
Keep movement controlled.
Lower torso back down slowly.
Avoid using excessive hip flexor drive.
Repeat.
description: A classic abdominal exercise involving lifting the entire torso off the floor towards the knees.

name: Decline Sit-ups
instructions: Lie on a decline bench, securing legs.
Place hands behind head or across chest.
Perform a sit-up, lifting torso towards knees against the decline resistance.
Lower slowly.
Repeat.
description: Performing sit-ups on a decline bench for increased range of motion and resistance.

name: Weighted Sit-ups
instructions: Lie on back (flat or decline), knees bent, feet flat/anchored.
Hold weight plate or dumbbell on chest or behind head.
Perform a sit-up, lifting torso towards knees.
Lower slowly.
Repeat.
description: Performing sit-ups while holding additional weight for increased resistance.

name: Janda Sit-up
instructions: Lie on back, knees bent.
Have a partner resist your ankles, OR actively try to pull your heels towards your glutes (isometrically contracting hamstrings).
Place hands behind head/across chest.
Attempt to perform a sit-up.
The hamstring contraction aims to inhibit hip flexors, forcing abs to work harder.
Focus entirely on abdominal contraction to lift torso.
Lower slowly.
Repeat.
description: A sit-up variation attempting to minimize hip flexor involvement by actively engaging the hamstrings.

name: Russian Twists
instructions: Sit on the floor, knees bent, feet flat on floor (easier) or lifted off floor (harder).
Lean back slightly, keeping back straight, forming a V-shape with torso and thighs.
Engage core.
Clasp hands together or keep arms bent.
Twist your torso from side to side, tapping hands (or weight) on floor beside each hip.
Keep hips relatively stable; rotation comes from torso.
Move slowly and with control.
Repeat.
description: A core exercise involving twisting the torso side to side while seated, targeting the obliques.

name: Weighted Russian Twists
instructions: Perform Russian twists while holding a dumbbell, weight plate, or medicine ball.
Hold the weight with both hands.
Twist torso side to side, tapping weight near each hip.
Maintain control and form.
Repeat.
description: Russian twists performed while holding added weight for increased resistance.

name: Medicine Ball Twist Pass
instructions: Sit back-to-back or side-by-side with a partner.
Maintain upright posture, core engaged.
One partner holds a medicine ball.
Twist torso to pass the ball to the partner.
Partner receives ball, twists to other side, and passes back (or continue around in circle if back-to-back).
Maintain controlled rotation.
Repeat for reps or time.
description: A partner core exercise involving passing a medicine ball side to side using torso rotation.

name: Cable Wood Chop (High-to-Low)
instructions: Set a cable pulley to a high position.
Attach a handle or rope.
Stand sideways to the machine.
Grasp attachment with both hands, arms extended.
Start with hands high on the side closest to machine.
Rotate torso and pull the handle diagonally downwards across your body towards the opposite knee/hip.
Keep arms relatively straight, pivot on back foot.
Control the movement.
Return slowly to start.
Complete reps on one side before switching.
Repeat.
description: A rotational core exercise mimicking a chopping motion from high to low using a cable.

name: Cable Wood Chop (Low-to-High)
instructions: Set a cable pulley to a low position.
Attach handle or rope.
Stand sideways to machine.
Grasp attachment with both hands.
Start with hands low on the side closest to machine.
Rotate torso and pull the handle diagonally upwards across your body towards the opposite shoulder.
Keep arms relatively straight, pivot on back foot.
Control the movement.
Return slowly to start.
Complete reps on one side before switching.
Repeat.
description: A rotational core exercise mimicking a reverse chopping motion from low to high using a cable.

name: Band Wood Chop
instructions: Anchor a resistance band high or low.
Stand sideways.
Grasp band with both hands.
Perform wood chop motion (high-to-low or low-to-high) against band resistance.
Control the rotation.
Complete reps on one side, then switch.
Repeat.
description: Performing wood chop rotational exercise using a resistance band.

name: Medicine Ball Wood Chop
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding medicine ball.
Start holding ball high over one shoulder.
Rotate torso and bring ball diagonally down across body towards opposite knee.
Bend knees and hips slightly.
Reverse motion, bringing ball back up.
Control the movement.
Complete reps on one side, then switch.
Repeat.
description: Performing the wood chop motion using a medicine ball for resistance.

name: Pallof Press (Cable)
instructions: Set cable pulley at chest height.
Attach handle.
Stand sideways to the machine, feet shoulder-width apart.
Grasp handle with both hands, holding it at center of chest.
Step away from machine to create tension.
Brace core tightly.
Press the handle straight out in front of your chest, keeping arms fully extended.
Resist the cable's pull trying to rotate your torso.
Hold briefly.
Slowly return handle to chest.
Maintain anti-rotation throughout.
Complete reps on one side, then switch.
Repeat.
description: An anti-rotation core exercise using a cable to resist rotational forces.

name: Pallof Press (Band)
instructions: Anchor resistance band at chest height.
Stand sideways.
Grasp band with both hands at chest.
Step away for tension.
Press band straight out, resisting rotation.
Hold.
Return slowly.
Complete reps, then switch sides.
Repeat.
description: Performing the Pallof press anti-rotation exercise using a resistance band.

name: Kneeling Pallof Press
instructions: Set cable pulley or anchor band at chest height.
Kneel sideways to anchor point (tall kneeling or half-kneeling).
Grasp handle/band at chest.
Brace core and glutes.
Press straight out, resisting rotation.
Hold.
Return slowly.
Complete reps, then switch sides.
Repeat.
description: Performing the Pallof press from a kneeling position, often increasing core stability demand.

name: Pallof Press with Rotation
instructions: Set up for Pallof Press (cable or band).
Press handle/band straight out.
While keeping arms extended, slowly rotate torso away from the anchor point.
Control the rotation back towards the anchor point.
Focus on controlled movement, resisting the pull.
Return handle to chest.
Complete reps, then switch sides.
Repeat.
description: Adding a controlled rotation away from the anchor point while arms are extended during a Pallof press.

name: Ab Wheel Rollout (Knees)
instructions: Kneel on a mat, holding ab wheel handles.
Place wheel on floor directly under shoulders.
Engage core tightly, keep back slightly rounded (avoid arching).
Slowly roll the wheel forward, extending your body.
Keep arms straight.
Roll out as far as you can maintain control and prevent lower back arching.
Use abs and lats to pull the wheel back to the starting position.
Repeat.
description: A challenging core exercise using an ab wheel, rolling out from a kneeling position.

name: Ab Wheel Rollout (Standing)
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding ab wheel.
Place wheel on floor in front of feet.
Keeping legs relatively straight, hinge at hips and roll wheel forward.
Extend body fully while maintaining tight core and flat/slightly rounded back.
Roll out as far as possible.
Use core and lats to pull wheel back towards feet.
Extremely advanced variation.
Repeat.
description: An advanced version of the ab wheel rollout performed from a standing position.

name: Barbell Rollout
instructions: Load a barbell with round plates (e.g., 45s or smaller that allow rolling).
Kneel or stand behind barbell.
Grip bar shoulder-width apart.
Perform rollout motion similar to ab wheel (roll bar forward, extend body, pull back).
Requires more stabilization than ab wheel.
Repeat.
description: Performing core rollouts using a loaded barbell instead of an ab wheel.

name: Stability Ball Rollout
instructions: Kneel facing a stability ball.
Place forearms or hands on top of the ball.
Engage core, keep back straight.
Roll the ball forward by extending your arms and body.
Maintain control on the unstable surface.
Roll out as far as comfortable.
Use core and lats to pull ball back.
Repeat.
description: Performing rollouts using a stability ball, adding an instability challenge.

name: Stability Ball Pike
instructions: Start in a high plank position with shins/feet resting on top of a stability ball.
Keep arms straight, body in line.
Engage core and lift hips high towards the ceiling, rolling the ball towards your hands.
Keep legs as straight as possible.
Aim for an inverted V (pike) position.
Slowly lower hips back down, rolling ball back to start.
Repeat.
description: A challenging core exercise using a stability ball, lifting the hips into a pike position.

name: Stability Ball Knee Tucks
instructions: Start in a high plank position with shins/feet resting on top of a stability ball.
Keep arms straight, body in line.
Engage core and pull your knees towards your chest, rolling the ball forward.
Keep back flat.
Extend legs back out slowly, rolling ball back to start.
Repeat.
description: A core exercise using a stability ball, tucking the knees towards the chest from a plank position.

name: Medicine Ball Slams
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a medicine ball.
Raise the ball overhead, fully extending body.
Forcefully slam the ball straight down onto the floor just in front of you.
Hinge at hips and bend knees as you slam.
Catch the ball on the bounce (or pick it up).
Immediately raise overhead for next rep.
Use a non-bouncy slam ball if preferred.
Repeat.
description: An explosive core and power exercise involving slamming a medicine ball into the ground.

name: Rotational Medicine Ball Slams
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding medicine ball.
Raise ball overhead and slightly to one side.
Rotate torso and slam the ball forcefully down onto the floor outside the opposite foot.
Pivot feet as needed.
Catch ball or pick up.
Raise ball overhead to other side for next rep.
Alternate sides.
Repeat.
description: Medicine ball slams performed with a rotational component, targeting the obliques.

name: Medicine Ball Rotational Toss
instructions: Stand sideways to a sturdy wall, feet shoulder-width apart.
Hold medicine ball with both hands.
Rotate torso away from wall.
Explosively rotate towards wall and toss the ball against it.
Catch the ball as it rebounds.
Immediately rotate away to prepare for next toss.
Control the movement.
Complete reps on one side, then switch.
Repeat.
description: An explosive rotational core exercise involving tossing a medicine ball against a wall.

name: Superman
instructions: Lie face down on floor, arms and legs extended.
Simultaneously lift arms, chest, and legs off the floor by contracting lower back and glutes.
Keep neck in line with spine, looking down or slightly forward.
Hold the 'flying' position briefly.
Lower slowly back down.
Repeat.
description: An exercise targeting the lower back, glutes, and hamstrings by lifting limbs off the floor while prone.

name: Alternating Superman
instructions: Lie face down, arms and legs extended.
Simultaneously lift your right arm and left leg off the floor.
Keep torso stable.
Hold briefly.
Lower back down.
Simultaneously lift your left arm and right leg.
Lower back down.
Continue alternating sides.
Repeat.
description: A variation of the superman lifting opposite arm and leg simultaneously, adding a coordination challenge.

name: Boat Pose
instructions: Sit on the floor, knees bent, feet flat.
Lean back slightly, keeping back straight.
Lift feet off the floor, balancing on sit bones.
Extend legs straight out (harder) or keep knees bent (easier), shins parallel to floor.
Extend arms forward parallel to floor, or keep hands on floor for support.
Form a V-shape with torso and legs.
Hold the position, breathing steadily.
Hold for time.
description: A yoga pose involving balancing on the sit bones with torso and legs lifted, challenging core strength and balance.

name: L-Sit
instructions: Sit on floor between parallettes or rings (or hands flat on floor/elevated blocks).
Place hands firmly on supports.
Press down, lifting hips and legs off the floor.
Keep arms straight, shoulders depressed.
Extend legs straight out in front, parallel to floor, forming an 'L' shape.
Hold the position, maintaining core tension.
Hold for time.
description: An advanced gymnastics hold requiring significant core, hip flexor, and triceps strength, supporting the body with straight legs extended forward.

name: Tuck L-Sit
instructions: Set up as for L-sit.
Press down to lift body.
Instead of extending legs straight, tuck your knees towards your chest.
Keep hips lifted off the floor.
Hold the tucked position.
Easier variation of the L-Sit.
Hold for time.
description: An L-sit variation performed with knees tucked towards the chest, making it less demanding on hip flexors.

name: Windshield Wipers
instructions: Lying: Lie flat on back, arms out to sides in T-shape. Lift legs straight up towards ceiling (or knees bent). Keeping shoulders down, lower legs towards one side, controlling the rotation. Stop before legs touch floor. Bring legs back to center. Lower legs to other side. Continue alternating.
Hanging: Hang from pull-up bar. Raise legs (straight or bent) towards bar. Control legs as you rotate them side to side like windshield wipers.
Repeat.
description: A core exercise involving rotating the legs side-to-side while lying or hanging, targeting the obliques.

name: Dragon Flag
instructions: Lie flat on back on bench or floor, gripping bench edge or sturdy object behind head.
Lift entire body off bench/floor, supported only by upper back/shoulders, keeping body rigid and straight.
Start from inverted position (legs towards ceiling).
Slowly lower entire body towards horizontal, maintaining rigid line from shoulders to feet.
Lower as far as possible with control.
Pull body back up (very hard) or focus on negative.
Can start with tuck or single leg variations.
Repeat.
description: An extremely advanced core exercise involving lowering the entire rigid body from an inverted position, requiring immense core strength.

name: Standing Side Bends (Dumbbell)
instructions: Stand tall, feet hip-width apart.
Hold a dumbbell in one hand at your side.
Keeping back straight, bend torso directly sideways towards the side holding the dumbbell.
Lower as far as comfortable.
Use opposite oblique to pull torso back upright.
Keep movement strict, avoid leaning forward/back.
Complete reps on one side, then switch.
Repeat.
description: Targeting the obliques by bending the torso sideways while holding a dumbbell.

name: Cable Side Bends
instructions: Set cable pulley to low position, attach handle.
Stand sideways to machine.
Grab handle with hand furthest from machine.
Bend torso sideways towards the machine, pulling against cable resistance.
Use opposite oblique to return to upright.
Complete reps, then switch sides.
Repeat.
description: Performing side bends using a cable machine for resistance.

name: Mountain Climbers
instructions: Start in a high plank position.
Keep core engaged, body straight.
Drive one knee towards your chest, keeping foot off floor.
Quickly switch legs, bringing the other knee towards chest while extending the first leg back.
Continue alternating legs rapidly, as if running in place.
Keep hips relatively stable; avoid bouncing.
Repeat for reps or time.
description: A dynamic core and conditioning exercise mimicking running in a plank position.

name: Cross-Body Mountain Climbers
instructions: Start in a high plank position.
Drive one knee (e.g., right) across your body towards the opposite elbow (left).
Return leg to start.
Drive the other knee (left) across towards the opposite elbow (right).
Continue alternating sides.
Focus on the torso twist.
Repeat.
description: A mountain climber variation bringing the knee towards the opposite elbow, increasing oblique engagement.

name: Turkish Get-Up
instructions: Lie on back holding KB/DB in one hand, arm extended towards ceiling.
Same side knee bent, foot flat; other leg straight, other arm out to side.
Roll up onto opposite elbow, keeping weight-bearing arm vertical.
Push up onto hand.
Lift hips off floor.
Sweep straight leg underneath body, placing knee down.
Move into half-kneeling position.
Stand up.
Reverse sequence carefully step-by-step back to lying position.
Complete reps on one side, then switch.
description: A complex, multi-step exercise moving from lying to standing while holding a weight overhead, building full-body stability and strength.

name: Suitcase Carry
instructions: Hold a heavy dumbbell or kettlebell in one hand, like carrying a suitcase.
Stand tall, shoulders back, core braced.
Walk forward for a set distance or time.
Resist the urge to lean away from the weight; keep torso upright.
Focus on maintaining posture and stability.
Switch hands and repeat.
Repeat.
description: A loaded carry exercise holding weight in one hand, challenging core stability, grip, and posture.

name: Windmill
instructions: Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width, one foot pointing forward, other slightly out.
Hold KB/DB overhead in one arm (e.g., right), keeping arm locked.
Look up at the weight.
Push hip out to the side of the weighted arm (right hip).
Keeping weighted arm vertical and legs relatively straight, hinge at hip and lower torso.
Reach free hand towards floor/foot.
Maintain eye contact with weight.
Return to standing by driving hip.
Complete reps, then switch sides.
Repeat.
description: A complex exercise involving hinging sideways while holding a weight overhead, improving shoulder stability, core strength, and hip/hamstring mobility.

name: Saxon Side Bends
instructions: Stand tall, feet hip-width apart.
Hold light dumbbells or a plate straight overhead with arms locked.
Keeping arms vertical, slowly bend your torso directly to one side.
Feel the stretch/contraction in the opposite oblique.
Return to center.
Bend slowly to the other side.
Maintain core tension and overhead arm position.
Repeat.
description: Performing side bends while holding weight(s) locked out overhead, increasing the stability challenge.

name: Barbell Clean
instructions: Start with barbell on floor, feet hip-width, shins close to bar.
Grip bar with overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulders.
Set back flat, chest up, shoulders over bar.
Initiate pull by driving legs (first pull).
As bar passes knees, explosively extend hips, knees, and ankles (second pull), shrugging powerfully.
Pull body under the bar, rotating elbows quickly around.
Catch the bar in a front rack position.
Power Clean: Catch in a partial squat and stand up.
Squat Clean: Catch in a full deep squat and stand up.
Lower bar under control.
description: An Olympic weightlifting movement involving pulling a barbell from the floor to the shoulders in one explosive motion.

name: Dumbbell Clean
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, dumbbells outside feet or between legs.
Hinge at hips, keep back flat, grip dumbbells.
Explosively extend hips, knees, and ankles, shrugging shoulders.
Pull dumbbells upwards, keeping them close to body.
As dumbbells reach chest height, quickly rotate elbows underneath.
Catch dumbbells in a front rack position (on shoulders), potentially dipping into a partial squat.
Stand up fully.
Lower dumbbells under control.
description: A variation of the clean performed with dumbbells, developing power and coordination.

name: Kettlebell Clean
instructions: Place kettlebell(s) slightly in front.
Hinge at hips, grip kettlebell(s).
Hike the kettlebell(s) back between legs.
Explosively drive hips forward.
As kettlebell(s) float up, guide them smoothly into the rack position (resting on forearm/bicep/shoulder).
Keep elbow tucked, avoid letting kettlebell slam onto forearm.
Stand tall in the rack position.
Lower kettlebell(s) under control.
description: A fundamental kettlebell movement involving swinging the kettlebell from between the legs into the rack position.

name: Hang Clean
instructions: Start holding the barbell/DB/KB at hang position (e.g., mid-thigh or above knee).
Initiate movement by explosively extending hips, knees, and ankles.
Shrug powerfully.
Pull body under the weight.
Catch in the front rack position (power or squat depth).
Stand up fully.
Lower weight back to hang position under control.
Focuses on the second pull phase.
description: A clean variation starting with the weight held at thigh or knee level ('hang' position).

name: Clean and Press
instructions: Perform a clean (barbell, DB, or KB) to bring the weight(s) to the shoulder/rack position.
Once stable in the rack position, brace core.
Strict Press: Press the weight(s) straight overhead using only shoulder and arm strength.
Push Press: Perform a slight dip and drive with legs to initiate the overhead press.
Lower the weight(s) back to the shoulders under control.
Lower weight(s) back to floor or hang position.
description: A compound exercise combining a clean (floor/hang to shoulders) immediately followed by an overhead press.

name: Clean and Jerk
instructions: Perform a clean (typically squat clean) to bring barbell to front rack position.
Recover to standing.
Perform the Jerk: Dip vertically by bending knees.
Explosively drive upwards with legs.
As bar moves up, quickly drop under the bar by splitting legs (split jerk) or re-bending knees (push jerk).
Catch bar overhead with locked arms.
Recover feet to parallel stance.
Lower bar under control.
description: One of the two primary Olympic weightlifting lifts, combining a clean with an overhead jerk.

name: Barbell Snatch
instructions: Start with barbell on floor, feet hip-width.
Take a wide (snatch) grip on the bar.
Set back flat, chest up, shoulders over bar.
Initiate pull by driving legs.
Explosively extend hips, knees, ankles (second pull), shrugging powerfully.
Pull bar upwards keeping it very close to body.
Pull body aggressively under the bar.
Catch the bar overhead in a full deep squat position with arms locked.
Stand up from the squat, keeping bar stable overhead.
Lower bar under control (often dropped from overhead in competition).
description: The second primary Olympic weightlifting lift, involving pulling a barbell from floor to overhead in one continuous, explosive motion.

name: Dumbbell Snatch (Single Arm)
instructions: Place dumbbell on floor between feet.
Hinge at hips, grip dumbbell with one hand (neutral grip).
Explosively extend hips, knees, ankles, pulling dumbbell upwards.
Keep dumbbell close to body, elbow high.
As dumbbell reaches chest/shoulder height, punch hand upwards, catching dumbbell overhead with locked arm.
May catch in partial squat.
Stand fully.
Lower dumbbell under control (often guided down path, not dropped).
Complete reps on one side, then switch.
description: A unilateral variation of the snatch performed with a dumbbell, developing explosive power.

name: Kettlebell Snatch (Single Arm)
instructions: Start with kettlebell slightly in front.
Hinge and hike kettlebell back between legs.
Explosively drive hips forward.
Guide kettlebell upwards close to body.
As it floats up, punch hand through and upwards, rotating kettlebell smoothly around wrist.
Catch kettlebell overhead with locked arm.
Avoid letting kettlebell slam onto forearm (requires technique).
Lower kettlebell under control (swing down or drop into rack then down).
Complete reps on one side, then switch.
description: An explosive kettlebell lift moving the bell from floor/swing to locked out overhead in one motion, requiring significant technique.

name: Hang Snatch
instructions: Start holding barbell/DB/KB at hang position (mid-thigh or above knee) with snatch grip.
Initiate movement by explosively extending hips, knees, ankles.
Shrug powerfully.
Pull weight upwards close to body.
Aggressively pull body under the weight.
Catch overhead with locked arms (power or squat depth).
Stand fully.
Lower weight back to hang position.
Focuses on second pull and turnover.
description: A snatch variation starting with the weight held at thigh or knee level ('hang' position).

name: Thruster (Barbell)
instructions: Start with barbell in front rack position, feet shoulder-width.
Perform a full front squat.
As you drive up out of the bottom of the squat, use the momentum to press the barbell explosively overhead.
Finish with bar locked out overhead, hips and knees fully extended.
Lower bar back to front rack position.
Immediately descend into the next squat.
Movement should be fluid.
Repeat.
