description: A compound exercise combining a front squat directly into an overhead push press in one fluid motion.

name: Thruster (Dumbbell)
instructions: Start holding dumbbells in front rack position (resting on shoulders).
Perform a full squat.
Drive up explosively from squat, using momentum to press dumbbells overhead.
Lock out overhead.
Lower dumbbells back to shoulders.
Descend into next squat.
Repeat.
description: Performing the thruster movement using dumbbells.

name: Thruster (Kettlebell)
instructions: Start holding one or two kettlebells in the rack position.
Perform a full squat.
Drive up explosively from squat, pressing kettlebell(s) overhead.
Lock out overhead.
Lower kettlebell(s) back to rack position.
Descend into next squat.
Repeat.
description: Performing the thruster movement using one or two kettlebells.

name: Cluster
instructions: Start with barbell on floor like a clean.
Perform a squat clean, catching bar in the bottom of a front squat.
Without pausing, drive directly up from the bottom of the squat into an overhead thruster/push press.
Lock out overhead.
Lower bar back to floor under control.
Reset for next rep.
Combines squat clean and thruster with no pause.
Repeat.
description: A complex lift combining a squat clean directly into a thruster without resetting at the shoulders.

name: Kettlebell Swing (Russian)
instructions: Stand feet slightly wider than hips, KB in front.
Hinge at hips, grip KB.
Hike KB back between legs.
Explosively drive hips forward, squeezing glutes.
Let KB swing up to chest height, arms relaxed.
Control swing back down with hip hinge.
Maintain flat back.
Repeat rhythmically.
description: A dynamic hip hinge exercise swinging a kettlebell to chest height, focusing on posterior chain power.

name: Kettlebell Swing (American)
instructions: Perform kettlebell swing as Russian style.
Continue the upward swing, guiding the kettlebell fully overhead with arms locked out.
Requires more shoulder mobility and stability.
Control swing back down.
Repeat rhythmically.
description: A kettlebell swing variation where the bell travels fully overhead, requiring more shoulder mobility.

name: Double Kettlebell Swing
instructions: Stand feet wider, one kettlebell placed inside each foot.
Hinge and grip both KBs.
Hike KBs back between legs.
Explosively drive hips forward, swinging both KBs up (typically Russian height).
Control swing back down.
Requires more strength and coordination.
Repeat.
description: Performing kettlebell swings holding one kettlebell in each hand.

name: Single Arm Kettlebell Swing
instructions: Perform kettlebell swing (Russian or American) holding KB in one hand.
Resist torso rotation using core.
Keep shoulder packed.
Can switch hands at top of swing if desired.
Complete reps on one side or alternate.
Repeat.
description: Performing kettlebell swings using only one arm, increasing the anti-rotation core challenge.

name: Muscle Up
instructions: Hang from rings or bar (rings allow false grip).
Initiate a powerful pull (can use kipping swing or strict strength).
As body rises, aggressively pull rings/bar towards lower chest/sternum.
Transition wrists over the top of rings/bar.
Finish by pressing out into a dip support position.
Lower under control by reversing steps.
Extremely complex and demanding movement.
Repeat.
description: An advanced gymnastics skill combining a pull-up with a transition into a dip, performed on rings or a bar.

name: Burpee
instructions: Start standing.
Drop hands to floor.
Jump feet back into high plank.
Lower chest and thighs to floor.
Push back up to plank.
Jump feet forward towards hands.
Explosively jump vertically, clapping hands overhead (optional).
Land softly.
Repeat.
description: A full-body conditioning exercise involving dropping to the floor, performing a push-up, and jumping back up.

name: Burpee Box Jump
instructions: Stand facing a box.
Perform a standard burpee (drop, push-up, jump feet in).
Instead of jumping vertically, immediately jump onto the box.
Land softly.
Step down from the box.
Repeat.
description: Combining a burpee with an immediate box jump for enhanced power and conditioning.

name: Burpee Pull-Up
instructions: Stand under a pull-up bar.
Perform a standard burpee.
On the vertical jump component, jump up to grab the pull-up bar.
Immediately perform one pull-up.
Drop back down to the floor.
Repeat.
description: Combining a burpee with an immediate pull-up for a demanding full-body strength and conditioning challenge.

name: Devil Press
instructions: Start standing holding dumbbells at sides.
Place dumbbells on floor, jump feet back to plank (hands on dumbbells).
Perform a push-up (chest touches floor between dumbbells).
Jump feet forward towards dumbbells.
Immediately swing dumbbells back between legs (like KB swing).
Explosively extend hips and pull/swing dumbbells overhead in one motion (like double DB snatch).
Lock out overhead.
Lower dumbbells back to floor to start next rep.
Repeat.
description: A high-intensity complex combining a burpee with dumbbells directly into a double dumbbell snatch.

name: Man Maker
instructions: Start in plank position holding dumbbells.
Perform one push-up.
Perform a single-arm row with right arm.
Perform a single-arm row with left arm.
Jump feet forward.
Perform a dumbbell squat clean (bring DBs to shoulders, squat down).
Stand up from squat and perform an overhead press (thruster).
Lower dumbbells back to floor.
That is one rep. Repeat sequence.
description: A complex sequence involving a push-up, two rows, a squat clean, and a thruster, all performed with dumbbells.

name: Bear Crawl
instructions: Start on hands and knees, hands under shoulders, knees under hips.
Lift knees slightly off floor, back flat, core engaged.
Move opposite hand and foot forward simultaneously (right hand, left foot).
Move other opposite hand and foot forward (left hand, right foot).
Keep hips low and stable.
Crawl forward or backward for distance or time.
description: A quadrupedal movement pattern challenging core stability, coordination, and shoulder/hip strength.

name: Crab Walk
instructions: Sit on floor, knees bent, feet flat.
Place hands on floor behind you, fingers forward.
Lift hips off floor.
Walk forward or backward by moving opposite hand and foot.
Keep hips lifted.
Move for distance or time.
description: Walking on hands and feet with chest facing up, warming up/working shoulders, triceps, and core.

name: Inchworm with Push-Up
instructions: Start standing tall.
Hinge at hips, place hands on floor.
Walk hands forward into high plank position.
Perform one push-up.
Walk hands back towards feet, keeping legs straight.
Return to standing.
Alternatively, walk feet towards hands after push-up.
Repeat.
description: Combining the inchworm mobility drill with a push-up for added upper body work.

name: Farmer's Walk
instructions: Pick up heavy dumbbells, kettlebells, farmer's walk handles, or trap bar.
Stand tall, chest up, shoulders back, core braced.
Walk forward with controlled steps for a set distance or time.
Maintain posture; avoid leaning excessively.
Focus on grip strength and maintaining stability.
Set weights down under control.
description: A loaded carry exercise involving walking while holding heavy weights in each hand, building grip, core, and overall strength.

name: Suitcase Carry
instructions: Hold a heavy dumbbell or kettlebell in one hand.
Stand tall, shoulders back, core braced.
Walk forward for distance or time.
Actively resist leaning away from the weight; keep torso upright.
Switch hands and repeat.
Challenges anti-lateral flexion.
description: A loaded carry holding weight in only one hand, intensely challenging oblique and core stability.

name: Overhead Carry
instructions: Safely lift one or two dumbbells/kettlebells/plate overhead.
Lock elbows, keep weight stable directly over shoulders/spine.
Keep core braced, ribs down.
Walk forward with controlled steps for distance or time.
Maintain overhead stability.
Lower weight safely.
description: A loaded carry exercise involving walking while holding weight(s) locked out overhead, building shoulder and core stability.

name: Zercher Carry
instructions: Lift a barbell or sandbag into the crook of your elbows (Zercher position).
Clasp hands together.
Stand tall, core braced, maintain upright posture.
Walk forward for distance or time.
Challenges upper back strength, core stability, and pain tolerance.
Set weight down carefully.
description: A loaded carry performed holding the weight in the crook of the elbows, heavily taxing the upper back and core.

name: Yoke Carry
instructions: Position yourself under a loaded yoke frame, resting the crossbar across your upper back.
Stand up explosively, lifting the yoke.
Brace core and entire body tightly.
Take small, fast steps forward for distance or time.
Maintain balance and momentum.
Set yoke down under control.
A staple strongman event.
description: A strongman event involving carrying a heavy weighted frame (yoke) across the shoulders for distance or time.

name: Sled Push / Drag
instructions: Push: Load sled, grip handles, lean forward, drive with legs.
Drag: Attach straps, walk forward (pulling behind) or backward (pulling towards), use legs and back.
Maintain braced core and good posture.
Move for distance or time.
description: Pushing or pulling a weighted sled for strength and conditioning, targeting legs, back, and core.

name: Tire Flip
instructions: Approach tire, get low (squat/deadlift stance), back flat.
Grip under tire edge.
Drive with legs and hips.
As tire lifts, transition hands to push.
Drive tire up and over.
Use proper technique, select appropriate tire size.
Repeat.
description: A full-body power exercise involving flipping a large tire end-over-end.

name: Log Clean and Press
instructions: Approach log implement.
Deadlift log to lap.
Roll log up torso into front rack position (neutral grip handles).
Stand fully.
Perform overhead press (strict, push press, or jerk).
Lock out overhead.
Lower log under control back to floor.
A staple strongman lift.
Repeat.
description: A strongman exercise involving cleaning a log implement to the shoulders and pressing it overhead.

name: Atlas Stone Lift
instructions: Approach atlas stone, feet wide.
Squat down low, wrap arms around stone, hug tightly to chest.
Keep back rounded but tight.
Drive with legs and hips to lift stone to lap.
Readjust grip, get hands underneath.
Explosively extend hips and pull stone upwards.
Load stone onto platform or over bar.
Requires specific technique and tacky for grip.
Repeat.
description: A classic strongman event lifting a heavy spherical stone from the floor onto a platform or over a bar.

name: Wall Balls
instructions: Stand facing a wall with a target marked at specific height (e.g., 9-10 ft).
Hold medicine ball at chest level in front rack position.
Perform a full squat.
As you drive up from squat, explosively throw the ball upwards towards the target.
Catch the ball as it comes down, absorbing it back into the start of the next squat.
Maintain rhythm.
Repeat.
description: A conditioning exercise combining a squat with an overhead medicine ball throw against a wall target.

name: Turkish Get-Up
instructions: Detailed sequence: Lie down, press weight up, roll to elbow, push to hand, lift hips, sweep leg through, kneel, stand up. Reverse steps carefully.
Keep weight-bearing arm locked and vertical, eye on the weight.
Move slowly and deliberately through each step.
Complete reps on one side, then switch.
description: A complex exercise moving from lying to standing and back down while holding a weight overhead, building stability and coordination.

name: Sandbag Exercises
instructions: Perform various movements using an awkward, shifting sandbag:
Carry: Hug bag to chest or throw over shoulder and walk for distance.
Clean: Explosively lift bag from floor to shoulder/chest.
Squat: Hold bag in front rack, Zercher, or overhead position and squat.
Load: Lift bag onto platform.
Focus on maintaining core stability and controlling the unstable load.
description: Utilizing a sandbag for various compound movements like carries, cleans, and squats, challenging grip and stability due to the shifting load.

name: Steady State Running
instructions: Select a comfortable running speed on the treadmill or maintain a consistent pace outdoors.
Run at this steady, moderate intensity for a sustained period (e.g., 20-60 minutes).
Focus on maintaining consistent breathing and good running form.
Keep heart rate within a moderate aerobic zone (e.g., 60-75% of max heart rate).
description: Running at a sustained, manageable pace for an extended duration to build aerobic capacity.

name: Jogging
instructions: Run at a slow, comfortable pace, slower than steady state running.
Maintain a relaxed form and breathing pattern where conversation is possible.
Can be performed outdoors or on a treadmill.
Suitable for warm-ups, cool-downs, recovery days, or low-intensity cardio.
description: A low-intensity form of running performed at a relaxed, conversational pace.

name: Sprinting
instructions: Perform a thorough warm-up including dynamic stretches and build-up runs.
Run at maximum or near-maximum effort for a short distance (e.g., 50-200m) or time (10-30s).
Focus on powerful leg drive and arm swing.
Allow for full recovery (walking or complete rest) between sprints (e.g., 2-5 minutes).
Can be done on flat ground, hills, or a treadmill.
description: Running at maximal effort for short durations with full recovery to improve speed and anaerobic fitness.

name: Interval Running
instructions: Alternate periods of higher-intensity running with periods of lower-intensity recovery (jogging or walking).
Structured intervals: Follow a set work-to-rest ratio (e.g., run hard for 1 minute, jog/walk for 2 minutes).
Fartlek (unstructured): Vary pace based on feel, landmarks, or time cues during a continuous run.
Warm up before and cool down after.
description: Alternating between periods of faster running and slower recovery periods to improve cardiovascular fitness.

name: Steady State Cycling
instructions: Cycle on an outdoor bike or indoor stationary bike.
Maintain a consistent, moderate intensity level (cadence and resistance/gear).
Cycle for a sustained period (e.g., 20-60+ minutes).
Keep heart rate within a moderate aerobic zone.
Adjust bike setup for comfort and proper form.
description: Cycling at a sustained, manageable intensity for an extended duration to build aerobic fitness.

name: Interval Cycling
instructions: Use a stationary bike (spin bike, air bike, etc.).
Alternate periods of high-intensity cycling (increased resistance, faster cadence, standing sprints) with periods of lower-intensity recovery cycling.
Follow a structured interval plan (e.g., 30 seconds hard, 60 seconds easy) or attend a spin class.
Warm up before and cool down after.
description: Alternating periods of high-intensity effort with recovery periods on a stationary bike.

name: Swimming Laps
instructions: Swim continuous laps in a pool using preferred strokes (freestyle, backstroke, breaststroke, etc.).
Maintain a consistent, moderate pace for the desired duration or distance.
Focus on efficient stroke technique and rhythmic breathing.
Low-impact exercise engaging multiple muscle groups.
description: A full-body, low-impact cardiovascular exercise involving swimming continuous laps in a pool.

name: Interval Swimming
instructions: Alternate periods of faster, higher-intensity swimming (sprints) with periods of slower recovery swimming or complete rest.
Intervals can be structured based on distance (e.g., swim 50m hard, rest 30s) or time (e.g., swim hard 1 min, easy 1 min).
Focus on maintaining technique during high-intensity efforts.
Warm up before and cool down after.
description: Alternating between periods of high-intensity swimming and recovery periods.

name: Steady State Rowing
instructions: Use a rowing machine (ergometer).
Row at a consistent, moderate intensity (stroke rate and power/split time).
Maintain proper technique: Legs drive first, then lean back with core, finish with arm pull. Reverse order on recovery.
Row for a sustained duration (e.g., 20-40 minutes).
Keep heart rate in a moderate aerobic zone.
description: Rowing at a sustained, manageable pace on a machine for aerobic fitness and full-body conditioning.

name: Interval Rowing
instructions: Use a rowing machine.
Alternate periods of high-intensity rowing (e.g., maximal effort sprints for distance like 250m or 500m, or time intervals like 1 min hard) with periods of low-intensity recovery rowing or rest.
Focus on powerful, efficient strokes during work intervals.
Warm up before and cool down after.
description: Alternating between high-intensity rowing efforts and recovery periods on a machine.

name: Elliptical Training
instructions: Step onto the elliptical pedals and grasp handles (or stationary grips).
Move pedals in a smooth, continuous elliptical motion.
Push and pull handles if desired for upper body engagement.
Adjust resistance and incline to desired intensity.
Can be performed at a steady state or using interval programs.
Maintain upright posture.
description: A low-impact cardiovascular exercise machine simulating running or stair climbing motion.

name: Stair Climbing
instructions: Use a stair climbing machine (e.g., StepMill with revolving stairs or pedal climber).
Maintain an upright posture, minimizing reliance on handrails for support.
Select a speed/level that provides a moderate challenge.
Climb continuously for the desired duration (steady state) or utilize interval programs.
Focus on consistent stepping rhythm.
description: Simulating the action of climbing stairs on a machine for cardiovascular and lower body endurance.

name: Jump Rope / Skipping
instructions: Hold jump rope handles, rope behind heels.
Swing rope over head.
Jump lightly on balls of feet as rope passes underneath.
Maintain a rhythm.
Variations: Basic bounce (small hop), Alternate foot, High knees, Butt kicks, Double unders (two rotations per jump), Crossovers.
Perform continuously for time or intervals.
description: A high-impact cardio exercise using a rope, improving coordination, agility, and conditioning.

name: Boxing Training
instructions: Shadow Boxing: Practice punches (jabs, crosses, hooks, uppercuts), defensive movements (slips, rolls), and footwork without impact.
Heavy Bag Work: Strike a heavy bag using proper form and combinations. Move around the bag, maintaining stance and defense.
Typically performed in timed rounds (e.g., 2-3 minutes) with rest periods.
description: Cardiovascular and skill-based workout using boxing movements (shadow or on heavy bag).

name: Kickboxing Training
instructions: Combine boxing punches with various kicks (front, roundhouse, side, teep, knee strikes) and defensive maneuvers.
Practice combinations and footwork either shadow boxing or striking a heavy bag/pads.
Focus on technique, power, and flow.
Typically performed in timed rounds with rest.
description: A cardiovascular workout combining punches, kicks, knee strikes, and footwork.

name: Circuit Training
instructions: Select a series of exercises (e.g., 5-10) targeting different muscle groups or movement patterns.
Perform each exercise for a set number of repetitions or time.
Move immediately (or with minimal rest) to the next exercise in the circuit.
Complete all exercises in the circuit for one round.
Rest for a longer period (e.g., 1-3 minutes) between rounds.
Repeat for desired number of rounds.
description: Performing multiple exercises sequentially with minimal rest between them to challenge strength and cardio.

name: High-Intensity Interval Training (HIIT)
target: anaerobic capacity / cardiovascular endurance / fat loss
instructions: Choose exercises that can be performed at very high intensity (e.g., sprints, burpees, jump squats, battle ropes, air bike sprints).
Perform the chosen exercise at maximal or near-maximal effort for a short duration (e.g., 20-60 seconds).
Follow immediately with a period of complete rest or very low-intensity active recovery (e.g., 10-90 seconds).
Repeat the work/rest cycle for a set number of rounds or total time.
Requires thorough warm-up and cool-down.
description: A training method alternating short bursts of intense anaerobic exercise with brief recovery periods.

name: Tabata Training
instructions: Choose one or more exercises.
Perform the exercise at maximum intensity for 20 seconds.
Rest completely for 10 seconds.
Repeat this 20s work / 10s rest cycle 8 times for a total of 4 minutes per exercise.
Requires maximal effort during the work intervals.
description: A specific type of HIIT involving 8 rounds of 20 seconds work followed by 10 seconds rest.

name: Hiking / Rucking
instructions: Hiking: Walk outdoors on trails or varied terrain, adjusting pace based on incline and difficulty.
Rucking: Perform hiking while carrying a weighted backpack (rucksack). Load pack appropriately (e.g., 10-20% of bodyweight to start).
Maintain good posture, especially when rucking.
Engage core.
Perform for desired distance or duration.
description: Walking outdoors on varied terrain, optionally with a weighted backpack (rucking), for endurance.

name: Jumping Jacks
instructions: Stand with feet together, arms at sides.
Simultaneously jump feet apart (wider than shoulder-width) while raising arms laterally overhead.
Simultaneously jump feet back together while lowering arms back to sides.
Maintain a continuous, rhythmic pace.
Perform for time or repetitions.
description: A fundamental full-body calisthenic exercise used for warm-ups and cardiovascular conditioning.

name: High Knees (Cardio Pace)
instructions: Stand tall.
Run in place at a quick pace, driving knees up high towards the chest with each step.
Aim for thighs to become parallel to the floor.
Pump arms in coordination with legs.
Stay light on the balls of the feet.
Perform for time or repetitions.
description: Running in place while lifting the knees high, performed at a pace suitable for cardiovascular training.

name: Butt Kicks (Cardio Pace)
instructions: Stand tall.
Jog lightly in place.
Focus on bringing your heels up towards your glutes with each step.
Keep knees pointing generally downwards.
Maintain a quick, light rhythm suitable for cardio.
Pump arms naturally.
Perform for time or repetitions.
description: Jogging in place while actively kicking the heels towards the glutes, performed at a cardio pace.

name: Mountain Climbers (Cardio Pace)
instructions: Start in a high plank position (hands under shoulders, body straight).
Engage core.
Quickly alternate driving one knee towards the chest, then the other, mimicking a running motion.
Stay light on the feet.
Keep hips relatively stable and low (avoid excessive bouncing).
Maintain a fast, continuous pace for time or repetitions.
description: Performing the mountain climber exercise at a sustained, rapid pace for cardiovascular benefits.

name: Burpees (Cardio Focus)
instructions: Start standing.
Squat down, place hands on floor.
Jump feet back to plank.
Perform a push-up (chest to floor optional for speed).
Jump feet forward towards hands.
Jump vertically.
Perform continuously at a challenging pace for a set time or number of repetitions.
Focus on maintaining rhythm and minimizing rest.
description: Using the burpee exercise primarily for cardiovascular conditioning by performing reps continuously at pace.

name: Skipping (Movement)
instructions: Perform a basic skipping locomotion pattern without a rope.
Step forward onto one foot.
Perform a small hop on that same foot while simultaneously driving the opposite knee upward.
Land on the opposite foot and repeat the step-hop.
Continue alternating feet, moving forward or in place.
Maintain a light, bouncy rhythm.
description: A locomotor skill involving a step-hop pattern, used for warm-ups, light cardio, and coordination.

name: VersaClimber
instructions: Adjust foot straps and handle height on the VersaClimber.
Stand on pedals, grasp handles.
Initiate a climbing motion using contralateral movement (opposite arm and leg move together) - step down with right foot while pulling down with left hand, and vice versa.
Maintain a consistent rhythm and range of motion (step height).
Keep core engaged.
Perform for time or distance, steady state or intervals.
description: A low-impact machine simulating climbing, offering a challenging full-body cardiovascular workout.

name: SkiErg
target: cardiovascular endurance / upper body endurance / core strength
instructions: Stand facing the SkiErg machine, feet hip-width apart.
Grasp handles with arms extended overhead or slightly bent.
Engage core, hinge slightly at hips and knees.
Pull handles downwards forcefully using lats, core, and triceps, finishing near thighs.
Extend hips and knees slightly during the pull.
Control the return of handles overhead.
Repeat in a powerful, rhythmic motion.
Perform for time or distance, steady state or intervals.
description: A machine simulating Nordic skiing's poling motion, emphasizing upper body, core, and cardiovascular endurance.

name: Air Bike / Assault Bike
target: cardiovascular endurance / full body conditioning / power
instructions: Adjust seat height on the air bike.
Place feet on pedals, grasp moving arm handles.
Simultaneously pedal with legs and push/pull with arms.
Resistance is generated by the fan and increases with effort.
Maintain consistent effort for steady state or perform high-intensity intervals (e.g., max calories in 1 minute, sprints).
Keep core engaged.
description: A high-intensity conditioning tool using fan resistance, engaging both upper and lower body simultaneously.

name: Battle Ropes
target: cardiovascular endurance / upper body endurance / power
instructions: Anchor the center of a heavy battle rope.
Hold one end in each hand, facing the anchor point.
Assume an athletic stance (feet shoulder-width, knees bent, core braced).
Perform various patterns for time:
Alternating Waves: Move arms up and down alternately to create waves.
Double Waves: Move both arms up and down together.
Slams: Lift both ends overhead and slam ropes down.
Circles: Make large circles with arms (inward or outward).
Maintain intensity.
description: A conditioning tool using heavy ropes manipulated in various patterns to challenge cardio and muscular endurance.

name: Agility Ladder Drills
instructions: Lay an agility ladder flat on the ground.
Perform various footwork drills moving through the ladder:
Linear: One foot in each square, two feet in each square.
Lateral: Sideways shuffle, stepping in and out of squares.
Complex: Ickey shuffle, Carioca.
Focus on quick, light, precise foot contacts.
Stay low and keep eyes up.
Maintain a brisk pace for conditioning.
description: Drills performed using an agility ladder to enhance foot speed, coordination, agility, and cardiovascular fitness when done at pace.

name: Cone Drills
instructions: Set up cones in various patterns (e.g., line for sprints, T-drill, square, pro-agility).
Perform drills requiring sprinting, shuffling, backpedaling, and changing direction around the cones.
Examples: Sprint to cone and back, shuffle between cones, T-drill (sprint forward, shuffle side, shuffle other side, backpedal).
Focus on sharp cuts, acceleration, and deceleration.
Perform multiple repetitions with rest.
description: Drills using cones to improve acceleration, deceleration, change of direction ability, and agility.

name: Dead Hang (Two Arms)
instructions: Grasp a pull-up bar with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
Let your body hang with arms fully extended and shoulders relaxed or slightly engaged.
Maintain your grip and hang for the maximum possible time.
Focus on breathing steadily.
Release grip slowly.
description: Hanging passively from a bar to improve grip endurance and decompress the spine.

name: Single Arm Dead Hang
instructions: Grasp a pull-up bar firmly with one hand.
Carefully release the other hand and let your body hang.
Engage your shoulder and core to maintain stability and resist rotation.
Hang for the maximum possible time.
Switch arms and repeat.
description: Hanging from a bar using only one arm, significantly increasing the demand on grip strength and shoulder stability.

name: Towel Hang / Pull-Up
instructions: Drape one or two towels evenly over a pull-up bar.
Grasp the ends of the towel(s) firmly.
For Hangs: Let your body hang with arms extended, focusing on gripping the towels as hard as possible for time.
For Pull-Ups: Perform pull-ups while maintaining a strong grip on the towels.
Lower under control.
description: Performing hangs or pull-ups while gripping towels draped over a bar to intensely challenge crushing grip strength.

name: Fat Grip Training
secondaryMuscles: Varies by exercise (e.g., biceps for curls, back for rows)
instructions: Attach thick grip adapters (e.g., Fat Gripz) around the handles of barbells, dumbbells, pull-up bars, or cable attachments.
Perform your chosen exercise (curls, rows, presses, deadlifts, carries, pull-ups) using the thicker grip.
The increased diameter forces greater activation of forearm and hand muscles.
Use appropriate weight, as the thicker grip makes holding significantly harder.
description: Using thick grip adapters on various equipment handles to increase the challenge to grip strength and forearm muscles.

name: Plate Pinch Hold
instructions: Select two weight plates of equal size (start light, smooth sides are harder).
Place them together, smooth sides facing outwards.
Grip the plates between your fingers and thumb (pinch grip).
Lift the plates off the floor.
Stand tall and hold the pinch for maximum time.
Can also be done one-handed with a single thicker plate or multiple plates.
Set down carefully.
description: Holding weight plates pinched between the fingers and thumb to specifically build pinch grip strength.

name: Farmer's Walk (Grip Focus)
instructions: Select heavy dumbbells, kettlebells, or farmer's walk handles that challenge your grip.
Pick up the weights with a firm grip, stand tall, shoulders back, core braced.
Walk forward for a set distance or time.
Focus intently on maintaining your grip throughout the walk.
Set weights down under control when grip fatigues or distance/time is met.
description: Performing heavy farmer's walks with the primary goal of taxing and improving grip endurance.

name: Suitcase Carry (Grip/Core Focus)
instructions: Select a heavy dumbbell or kettlebell.
Hold it firmly in one hand at your side.
Stand tall, brace core, and actively resist leaning away from the weight.
Walk forward for a set distance or time, focusing on maintaining both grip and upright posture.
Switch hands and repeat.
description: A unilateral carry challenging both grip endurance in the carrying hand and anti-lateral flexion strength in the core.

name: Barbell Wrist Curl
instructions: Sit on a bench, holding a barbell with an underhand grip (palms up).
Rest your forearms on your thighs or across the bench edge, allowing wrists to hang off.
Lower the barbell by extending your wrists.
Curl the barbell upwards by flexing only your wrists as high as possible.
Squeeze your forearm flexors at the top.
Lower slowly under control.
Repeat.
description: An isolation exercise for the forearm flexor muscles using a barbell and wrist flexion.

name: Barbell Reverse Wrist Curl
instructions: Sit on a bench, holding a barbell with an overhand grip (palms down).
Rest your forearms on your thighs or across the bench edge, allowing wrists to hang off.
Lower the barbell by flexing your wrists.
Extend your wrists upwards, lifting the back of your hands towards the ceiling.
Squeeze your forearm extensors at the top.
Lower slowly under control.
Repeat.
description: An isolation exercise for the forearm extensor muscles using a barbell and wrist extension.

name: Dumbbell Wrist Curl
instructions: Sit holding dumbbells with palms facing up.
Rest forearms on thighs or bench edge, wrists hanging off.
Lower dumbbells by extending wrists.
Curl dumbbells upwards by flexing wrists.
Squeeze at the top.
Lower slowly.
Repeat.
description: Performing wrist curls (palms up) using dumbbells for isolating forearm flexors.

name: Dumbbell Reverse Wrist Curl
instructions: Sit holding dumbbells with palms facing down.
Rest forearms on thighs or bench edge, wrists hanging off.
Lower dumbbells by flexing wrists.
Extend wrists upwards.
Squeeze at the top.
Lower slowly.
Repeat.
description: Performing reverse wrist curls (palms down) using dumbbells for isolating forearm extensors.

name: Hand Gripper Training
instructions: Select a hand gripper with appropriate resistance.
Hold the gripper firmly in one hand.
Squeeze the handles together with maximum force until they touch or you reach your limit.
For Reps: Release slowly and repeat.
For Holds: Hold the fully closed position (or near closed) for time.
Train both hands.
description: Using calibrated spring-loaded hand grippers to develop crushing grip strength through repetitions or timed holds.

name: Fingerboard Hangs
instructions: Requires a climbing fingerboard/hangboard mounted securely.
Select a specific type of hold (e.g., four-finger edge, three-finger pocket, sloper).
Carefully place fingers on the hold with desired grip (e.g., open hand, half crimp, full crimp - use caution with crimps).
Engage shoulders (pull shoulder blades down slightly, avoid hanging completely passive).
Lift feet off the ground and hang for a predetermined time (e.g., 5-15 seconds).
Rest adequately between hangs (e.g., 1-3 minutes).
Follow structured protocols to avoid injury.
description: Hanging from small edges on a climbing-specific board to build finger strength and endurance, primarily for rock climbers.

name: Rice Bucket Training
instructions: Fill a bucket (e.g., 5-gallon) with uncooked rice.
Plunge one or both hands deep into the rice.
Perform various movements against the resistance of the rice:
- Forcefully open and close your fists.
- Stab fingers straight down and then spread them wide.
- Rotate wrists clockwise and counter-clockwise.
- Pinch fingers together.
Perform each movement for time (e.g., 30-60 seconds).
description: Using a bucket of rice to provide resistance for various hand, finger, and wrist strengthening exercises.

name: Bottoms-Up Kettlebell Press/Carry
instructions: Grip a kettlebell handle tightly, ensuring the bell is balanced upside down (bottom facing ceiling).
Carefully clean the kettlebell to the rack position, maintaining the bottoms-up orientation.
For Press: From rack, strictly press the kettlebell overhead, keeping it balanced.
For Carry: Hold the kettlebell stable in the rack or overhead position and walk for distance or time.
Requires intense focus, grip, and stabilization.
Start light.
description: Holding, carrying, or pressing a kettlebell upside down, demanding extreme grip, wrist, forearm, and shoulder stabilization.

name: Barbell Hold for Time
instructions: Set up a barbell in a rack at a height allowing you to lift it without a full deadlift, or deadlift it from the floor.
Use a weight that heavily challenges your grip.
Grip the bar with a double overhand grip (no straps, no mixed grip).
Stand tall, holding the bar with arms extended.
Maintain the grip for maximum possible time until failure.
Set the bar down safely.
description: Holding a heavy barbell with a double overhand grip for maximum time to build static grip strength and endurance.

name: Pinch Block Lift / Hold
instructions: Use a specialized pinch block (variable widths available) attached to a loading pin with weight.
Grip the block using only your fingers and thumb (pinch grip).
Lift the weight off the floor by extending your legs and back.
Either lift for maximum weight or hold a submaximal weight for maximum time.
Set down under control.
description: Lifting or holding weight attached to a specialized block using a pinch grip to target thumb and finger strength.

name: Rope Climb
instructions: Approach a securely anchored climbing rope.
Grasp the rope firmly.
Method 1 (Arms Only): Pull yourself up hand over hand.
Method 2 (With Legs): Use techniques like the J-hook or S-wrap with your feet to assist the climb while pulling with arms.
Ascend to the desired height.
Descend safely and under control using hand-over-hand technique (avoid sliding which causes burns).
description: Climbing a suspended rope using a combination of grip, pulling strength, and potentially leg technique.

name: Wrist Roller
instructions: Hold a wrist roller device (a bar/handle with a rope attached to a weight).
Stand with arms extended straight out in front at shoulder height.
Keeping arms elevated, rotate the handle using only wrist flexion/extension to wind the rope and lift the weight.
Alternate hands/direction of rotation.
Once the weight reaches the top, slowly unwind it back down under control using the same wrist motions.
Repeat for desired reps (up and down counts as one).
description: Using a specialized device to roll a weight up and down by rotating the wrists, building forearm muscular endurance.

name: Sledgehammer/Macebell Levering
instructions: Grip a sledgehammer or macebell handle firmly near the bottom (adjust grip position to change leverage/difficulty).
Hold the implement vertically in front of you, head up, arm slightly bent.
Slowly lower the head forward by deviating the wrist (like nodding 'yes'), keeping the arm stable.
Control the movement and return to the vertical position.
Can also perform side-to-side levering (like shaking head 'no' - radial/ulnar deviation).
Start very light and with hands choked up on the handle.
Perform for reps.
description: Using the leverage of a long-handled implement like a sledgehammer or macebell to strengthen the wrists through controlled deviation movements.

name: Band Pull-Apart (Variations)
instructions: Hold a resistance band with hands shoulder-width apart or slightly wider.
Extend arms straight in front at chest height.
Keep elbows slightly bent.
Pull the band apart horizontally by squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Overhand Grip: Palms face down.
Underhand Grip: Palms face up (emphasizes external rotation).
Diagonal: Pull band from high-to-low or low-to-high across the body.
Return slowly to the starting position under control.
Focus on initiating movement from the upper back.
Repeat.
description: An exercise using a resistance band to strengthen upper back posture muscles, performable with various grips/angles.

name: Banded Face Pull
instructions: Anchor a resistance band at chest or head height.
Grip the band with both hands (palms facing each other or down).
Step back to create tension.
Pull the band towards your face, aiming hands towards ears/temples.
Drive elbows back and high, externally rotating shoulders.
Squeeze upper back and rear deltoids.
Return slowly under control.
Repeat.
description: Using a resistance band to perform face pulls, targeting rear deltoids and external rotators for shoulder health.

name: YTWL Shoulder Exercise
instructions: Lie face down on the floor or an incline bench, or stand hinged at hips with flat back.
Optionally hold very light dumbbells.
Y: Extend arms diagonally overhead (thumbs up) forming a Y shape. Lift arms by squeezing upper back. Lower.
T: Extend arms straight out to sides (thumbs up) forming a T shape. Lift arms by squeezing shoulder blades. Lower.
W: Bend elbows, bringing hands near shoulders (thumbs up), forming a W shape. Lift elbows/hands by retracting shoulder blades. Lower.
L: Keep elbows bent at 90 degrees, upper arms parallel to floor (if prone/inclined). Externally rotate shoulders, lifting forearms/hands. Lower.
Perform each letter shape for reps, focusing on controlled movement and muscle activation.
description: A series of movements (Y, T, W, L shapes) targeting various upper back and rotator cuff muscles for shoulder stability.

name: External Rotation (Band/Cable - Elbow Tucked)
instructions: Anchor a resistance band or set cable pulley at elbow height.
Stand sideways to the anchor point.
Hold the band/handle with the hand furthest from the anchor.
Keep elbow tucked firmly into your side at a 90-degree bend.
Keeping elbow pinned, rotate your forearm outwards away from your body against the resistance.
Focus on rotation at the shoulder joint.
Move slowly and control the return.
Complete reps, then switch sides.
Repeat.
description: An exercise strengthening the external rotator cuff muscles with the elbow kept tucked at the side.

name: External Rotation (Side Lying)
instructions: Lie on your side, head supported.
Hold a light dumbbell in your top hand.
Keep the elbow of the top arm bent at 90 degrees and tucked against your side.
Keeping elbow pinned, rotate your forearm upwards towards the ceiling.
Focus on rotation at the shoulder.
Lower the dumbbell slowly back down.
Complete reps, then switch sides.
Repeat.
description: Strengthening the external rotator cuff muscles using a light dumbbell while lying on the side.

name: Internal Rotation (Band/Cable - Elbow Tucked)
instructions: Anchor a resistance band or set cable pulley at elbow height.
Stand sideways to the anchor point.
Hold the band/handle with the hand closest to the anchor.
Keep elbow tucked firmly into your side at a 90-degree bend, forearm starting outwards.
Keeping elbow pinned, rotate your forearm inwards across your body against the resistance.
Focus on internal rotation at the shoulder.
Move slowly and control the return.
Complete reps, then switch sides.
Repeat.
description: An exercise strengthening the internal rotator cuff muscles (subscapularis) with the elbow kept tucked.

name: Scapular Retractions
instructions: Standing/Seated: Sit or stand tall, arms relaxed or extended forward.
Squeeze your shoulder blades together as if trying to pinch something between them.
Hold the retraction briefly.
Relax and allow shoulder blades to return to neutral.
Prone: Lie face down, arms by sides or in T-shape. Lift arms slightly and squeeze shoulder blades together. Lower.
Focus on isolating scapular movement.
Repeat.
description: Isolating the movement of pulling the shoulder blades together (retraction) to activate mid-back muscles.

name: Scapular Protraction (Scap Push-ups)
instructions: Start in a high plank or hands-and-knees position.
Keep arms straight throughout.
Allow chest to sink towards floor, squeezing shoulder blades together (retraction).
Push through hands, rounding upper back slightly and spreading shoulder blades apart (protraction).
Focus only on shoulder blade movement.
Repeat the retraction and protraction.
description: Isolating shoulder blade protraction (spreading apart) and retraction, often targeting the serratus anterior.

name: Scapular Depression (Scap Pull-ups)
instructions: Hang from pull-up bar, arms straight (dead hang, shoulders elevated).
Keeping arms straight, pull shoulder blades down and back (depression).
Body lifts slightly.
Hold depressed position.
Relax back into dead hang.
Focus only on shoulder blade movement.
Repeat.
description: Isolating shoulder blade depression (pulling down) while hanging, activating lower traps.

name: Chin Tucks
instructions: Sit or stand tall against a wall, or lie flat on back.
Gently tuck your chin towards your throat, as if making a double chin.
Keep gaze level, don't nod head down.
Feel a slight stretch at back of neck and activation in front.
Hold briefly (e.g., 5 seconds).
Relax.
Avoid forcefully jamming chin down.
Repeat.
description: A subtle exercise to activate the deep neck flexor muscles, improving posture and reducing neck strain.

name: Deep Neck Flexor Activation
instructions: Lie flat on your back without a pillow.
Perform a very gentle chin tuck (as described in ID 542).
While maintaining the tuck, lift your head *very slightly* (just enough to slide paper underneath) off the floor.
Focus on feeling the muscles deep in the front of your neck working.
Hold for 5-10 seconds.
Lower slowly.
Avoid letting superficial neck muscles (SCM) bulge out.
Repeat.
description: A specific activation exercise for the deep neck flexors involving a slight head lift while chin is tucked.

name: Hip Flexor Stretch (Variations)
instructions: Kneeling: Kneel on one knee, other foot forward. Tuck tailbone, gently shift hips forward. Feel stretch in front of kneeling hip.
Standing: Stand tall, step one foot back into slight lunge. Tuck tailbone, bend front knee slightly. Feel stretch in back leg hip flexor.
Couch Stretch: Kneel facing away from wall/couch, back shin/foot against surface. Step front foot forward. Keep torso upright. Intense stretch.
Hold chosen stretch for desired duration.
Switch sides.
description: Stretching the muscles at the front of the hip, important for posture and mobility. Includes kneeling, standing, and couch variations.

name: Piriformis Stretch (Variations)
instructions: Figure Four (Lying): Lie on back, knees bent. Cross one ankle over opposite thigh. Pull thigh towards chest.
Figure Four (Seated): Sit tall. Cross ankle over opposite thigh. Gently press knee down or lean forward.
Seated Twist: Sit legs extended. Bend right knee, place foot outside left knee. Twist torso right, use left elbow outside right knee.
Hold chosen stretch for desired duration.
Switch sides.
description: Stretches targeting the deep piriformis muscle in the hip, often associated with glute tightness or sciatic-like symptoms.

name: Glute Activation Drills
instructions: Perform exercises designed to 'wake up' the glute muscles, often before a workout.
Glute Bridge: Lie on back, knees bent. Lift hips, squeeze glutes.
Clamshells: Lie on side, knees bent. Keep feet together, lift top knee.
Banded Lateral Walks: Band around ankles/knees. Step sideways in athletic stance.
Fire Hydrants: Hands and knees. Lift bent knee out to side.
Donkey Kicks: Hands and knees. Kick one heel towards ceiling.
Focus on feeling the glute muscles contract.
Perform controlled reps.
description: A set of exercises like bridges, clamshells, and band walks used to improve glute muscle firing patterns.

name: Wall Slides / Wall Angels
instructions: Stand with back against wall, feet slightly away.
Maintain contact with lower back, upper back, and head.
Bend elbows 90 degrees, raise arms so upper arms parallel to floor.
Press forearms and back of hands against wall.
Slowly slide arms upwards along wall, maintaining contact points.
Go as high as possible without losing contact or arching lower back.
Slowly slide arms back down.
Repeat.
description: An exercise against a wall to improve shoulder mobility, external rotation, and scapular control.

name: Blackburns
instructions: Lie face down on the floor, forehead resting lightly.
Sequence (Perform each step slowly for reps):
1. Arms straight by sides, palms down. Lift arms slightly, retract shoulder blades.
2. Move arms out to T-position, thumbs up. Lift arms, retract.
3. Move arms to Y-position, thumbs up. Lift arms, retract.
4. Bend elbows, bring hands near head (W-position), thumbs up. Lift arms, retract.
5. Can flow through sequence or perform reps at each position.
description: A prone exercise sequence involving various arm positions to strengthen the scapular retractors and rotator cuff.

name: Powell Raise
instructions: Lie on your side on a flat or incline bench, body angled slightly forward (around 30 degrees).
Hold a very light dumbbell in your top hand.
Let the arm hang down across your body.
Keeping elbow slightly bent, raise the dumbbell upwards and slightly backwards in an arc.
Focus on using the muscles at the back of the shoulder.
Movement happens primarily at the shoulder joint.
Lower slowly under control.
Complete reps, then switch sides.
Repeat.
description: A side-lying shoulder exercise targeting the posterior rotator cuff and deltoid, often used for shoulder health.

name: Cuban Press
instructions: Stand or sit holding very light dumbbells.
Perform an upright row motion, pulling dumbbells up towards shoulders, elbows high.
At the top of the row, externally rotate shoulders, bringing dumbbells up so forearms are vertical.
Press the dumbbells overhead.
Reverse the motion: Lower to external rotation position, internally rotate back to upright row top position, lower dumbbells down.
Perform slowly and with control, focusing on rotation.
Repeat.
description: A multi-part exercise combining an upright row, external rotation, and overhead press to improve shoulder mobility and rotator cuff strength.

name: Thoracic Extension over Foam Roller
instructions: Lie on your back with a foam roller positioned horizontally across your mid/upper back.
Bend knees, feet flat on floor.
Support your head with your hands (interlace fingers behind head).
Keep hips on the floor or slightly lifted.
Gently arch your upper back over the roller, extending your thoracic spine.
Support your head throughout.
Hold the gentle extension or perform small movements.
Can slightly shift roller position up or down the upper back.
Breathe deeply.
description: Using a foam roller to improve extension mobility in the upper/mid back (thoracic spine).

name: Cat-Cow
instructions: Start on hands and knees, hands under shoulders, knees under hips.
Inhale: Drop belly, arch back, lift head and tailbone (Cow Pose).
Exhale: Round spine towards ceiling, tuck chin and tailbone (Cat Pose).
Flow smoothly between poses, coordinating with breath.
Focus on articulating through the entire spine.
Repeat.
description: A yoga pose involving flexing and extending the spine to improve mobility and relieve tension.

name: Bird Dog (Stability Focus)
instructions: Start on hands and knees, neutral spine, core engaged.
Slowly extend opposite arm and leg simultaneously.
Focus intensely on preventing any movement or rotation in the torso and pelvis.
Keep hips and shoulders perfectly square to the floor.
Reach long.
Hold briefly, maintaining tension and stability.
Return slowly to start.
Alternate sides.
Emphasis is on control and stability, not speed or range.
Repeat.
description: Performing the Bird Dog exercise with a primary focus on maintaining absolute core and spinal stability throughout the movement.

name: Band Pull-Apart (Variations)
instructions: Hold a resistance band with hands shoulder-width apart or slightly wider.
Extend arms straight in front at chest height.
Keep elbows slightly bent.
Pull the band apart horizontally by squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Overhand Grip: Palms face down.
Underhand Grip: Palms face up (emphasizes external rotation).
Diagonal: Pull band from high-to-low or low-to-high across the body.
Return slowly to the starting position under control.
Focus on initiating movement from the upper back.
Repeat.
description: An exercise using a resistance band to strengthen upper back posture muscles, performable with various grips/angles.

name: Banded Face Pull
instructions: Anchor a resistance band at chest or head height.
Grip the band with both hands (palms facing each other or down).
Step back to create tension.
Pull the band towards your face, aiming hands towards ears/temples.
Drive elbows back and high, externally rotating shoulders.
Squeeze upper back and rear deltoids.
Return slowly under control.
Repeat.
description: Using a resistance band to perform face pulls, targeting rear deltoids and external rotators for shoulder health.

name: YTWL Shoulder Exercise
instructions: Lie face down on the floor or an incline bench, or stand hinged at hips with flat back.
Optionally hold very light dumbbells.
Y: Extend arms diagonally overhead (thumbs up) forming a Y shape. Lift arms by squeezing upper back. Lower.
T: Extend arms straight out to sides (thumbs up) forming a T shape. Lift arms by squeezing shoulder blades. Lower.
W: Bend elbows, bringing hands near shoulders (thumbs up), forming a W shape. Lift elbows/hands by retracting shoulder blades. Lower.
L: Keep elbows bent at 90 degrees, upper arms parallel to floor (if prone/inclined). Externally rotate shoulders, lifting forearms/hands. Lower.
Perform each letter shape for reps, focusing on controlled movement and muscle activation.
description: A series of movements (Y, T, W, L shapes) targeting various upper back and rotator cuff muscles for shoulder stability.

name: External Rotation (Band/Cable - Elbow Tucked)
instructions: Anchor a resistance band or set cable pulley at elbow height.
Stand sideways to the anchor point.
Hold the band/handle with the hand furthest from the anchor.
Keep elbow tucked firmly into your side at a 90-degree bend.
Keeping elbow pinned, rotate your forearm outwards away from your body against the resistance.
Focus on rotation at the shoulder joint.
Move slowly and control the return.
Complete reps, then switch sides.
Repeat.
description: An exercise strengthening the external rotator cuff muscles with the elbow kept tucked at the side.

name: External Rotation (Side Lying)
instructions: Lie on your side, head supported.
Hold a light dumbbell in your top hand.
Keep the elbow of the top arm bent at 90 degrees and tucked against your side.
Keeping elbow pinned, rotate your forearm upwards towards the ceiling.
Focus on rotation at the shoulder.
Lower the dumbbell slowly back down.
Complete reps, then switch sides.
Repeat.
description: Strengthening the external rotator cuff muscles using a light dumbbell while lying on the side.

name: Internal Rotation (Band/Cable - Elbow Tucked)
instructions: Anchor a resistance band or set cable pulley at elbow height.
Stand sideways to the anchor point.
Hold the band/handle with the hand closest to the anchor.
Keep elbow tucked firmly into your side at a 90-degree bend, forearm starting outwards.
Keeping elbow pinned, rotate your forearm inwards across your body against the resistance.
Focus on internal rotation at the shoulder.
Move slowly and control the return.
Complete reps, then switch sides.
Repeat.
description: An exercise strengthening the internal rotator cuff muscles (subscapularis) with the elbow kept tucked.

name: Scapular Retractions
instructions: Standing/Seated: Sit or stand tall, arms relaxed or extended forward.
Squeeze your shoulder blades together as if trying to pinch something between them.
Hold the retraction briefly.
Relax and allow shoulder blades to return to neutral.
Prone: Lie face down, arms by sides or in T-shape. Lift arms slightly and squeeze shoulder blades together. Lower.
Focus on isolating scapular movement.
Repeat.
description: Isolating the movement of pulling the shoulder blades together (retraction) to activate mid-back muscles.

name: Scapular Protraction (Scap Push-ups)
instructions: Start in a high plank or hands-and-knees position.
Keep arms straight throughout.
Allow chest to sink towards floor, squeezing shoulder blades together (retraction).
Push through hands, rounding upper back slightly and spreading shoulder blades apart (protraction).
Focus only on shoulder blade movement.
Repeat the retraction and protraction.
description: Isolating shoulder blade protraction (spreading apart) and retraction, often targeting the serratus anterior.

name: Scapular Depression (Scap Pull-ups)
instructions: Hang from pull-up bar, arms straight (dead hang, shoulders elevated).
Keeping arms straight, pull shoulder blades down and back (depression).
Body lifts slightly.
Hold depressed position.
Relax back into dead hang.
Focus only on shoulder blade movement.
Repeat.
description: Isolating shoulder blade depression (pulling down) while hanging, activating lower traps.

name: Chin Tucks
instructions: Sit or stand tall against a wall, or lie flat on back.
Gently tuck your chin towards your throat, as if making a double chin.
Keep gaze level, don't nod head down.
Feel a slight stretch at back of neck and activation in front.
Hold briefly (e.g., 5 seconds).
Relax.
Avoid forcefully jamming chin down.
Repeat.
description: A subtle exercise to activate the deep neck flexor muscles, improving posture and reducing neck strain.

name: Deep Neck Flexor Activation
instructions: Lie flat on your back without a pillow.
Perform a very gentle chin tuck (as described in ID 542).
While maintaining the tuck, lift your head *very slightly* (just enough to slide paper underneath) off the floor.
Focus on feeling the muscles deep in the front of your neck working.
Hold for 5-10 seconds.
Lower slowly.
Avoid letting superficial neck muscles (SCM) bulge out.
Repeat.
description: A specific activation exercise for the deep neck flexors involving a slight head lift while chin is tucked.

name: Hip Flexor Stretch (Variations)
instructions: Kneeling: Kneel on one knee, other foot forward. Tuck tailbone, gently shift hips forward. Feel stretch in front of kneeling hip.
Standing: Stand tall, step one foot back into slight lunge. Tuck tailbone, bend front knee slightly. Feel stretch in back leg hip flexor.
Couch Stretch: Kneel facing away from wall/couch, back shin/foot against surface. Step front foot forward. Keep torso upright. Intense stretch.
Hold chosen stretch for desired duration.
Switch sides.
description: Stretching the muscles at the front of the hip, important for posture and mobility. Includes kneeling, standing, and couch variations.

name: Piriformis Stretch (Variations)
instructions: Figure Four (Lying): Lie on back, knees bent. Cross one ankle over opposite thigh. Pull thigh towards chest.
Figure Four (Seated): Sit tall. Cross ankle over opposite thigh. Gently press knee down or lean forward.
Seated Twist: Sit legs extended. Bend right knee, place foot outside left knee. Twist torso right, use left elbow outside right knee.
Hold chosen stretch for desired duration.
Switch sides.
description: Stretches targeting the deep piriformis muscle in the hip, often associated with glute tightness or sciatic-like symptoms.

name: Glute Activation Drills
instructions: Perform exercises designed to 'wake up' the glute muscles, often before a workout.
Glute Bridge: Lie on back, knees bent. Lift hips, squeeze glutes.
Clamshells: Lie on side, knees bent. Keep feet together, lift top knee.
Banded Lateral Walks: Band around ankles/knees. Step sideways in athletic stance.
Fire Hydrants: Hands and knees. Lift bent knee out to side.
Donkey Kicks: Hands and knees. Kick one heel towards ceiling.
Focus on feeling the glute muscles contract.
Perform controlled reps.
description: A set of exercises like bridges, clamshells, and band walks used to improve glute muscle firing patterns.

name: Wall Slides / Wall Angels
instructions: Stand with back against wall, feet slightly away.
Maintain contact with lower back, upper back, and head.
Bend elbows 90 degrees, raise arms so upper arms parallel to floor.
Press forearms and back of hands against wall.
Slowly slide arms upwards along wall, maintaining contact points.
Go as high as possible without losing contact or arching lower back.
Slowly slide arms back down.
Repeat.
description: An exercise against a wall to improve shoulder mobility, external rotation, and scapular control.

name: Blackburns
instructions: Lie face down on the floor, forehead resting lightly.
Sequence (Perform each step slowly for reps):
1. Arms straight by sides, palms down. Lift arms slightly, retract shoulder blades.
2. Move arms out to T-position, thumbs up. Lift arms, retract.
3. Move arms to Y-position, thumbs up. Lift arms, retract.
4. Bend elbows, bring hands near head (W-position), thumbs up. Lift arms, retract.
5. Can flow through sequence or perform reps at each position.
description: A prone exercise sequence involving various arm positions to strengthen the scapular retractors and rotator cuff.

name: Powell Raise
instructions: Lie on your side on a flat or incline bench, body angled slightly forward (around 30 degrees).
Hold a very light dumbbell in your top hand.
Let the arm hang down across your body.
Keeping elbow slightly bent, raise the dumbbell upwards and slightly backwards in an arc.
Focus on using the muscles at the back of the shoulder.
Movement happens primarily at the shoulder joint.
Lower slowly under control.
Complete reps, then switch sides.
Repeat.
description: A side-lying shoulder exercise targeting the posterior rotator cuff and deltoid, often used for shoulder health.

name: Cuban Press
instructions: Stand or sit holding very light dumbbells.
Perform an upright row motion, pulling dumbbells up towards shoulders, elbows high.
At the top of the row, externally rotate shoulders, bringing dumbbells up so forearms are vertical.
Press the dumbbells overhead.
Reverse the motion: Lower to external rotation position, internally rotate back to upright row top position, lower dumbbells down.
Perform slowly and with control, focusing on rotation.
Repeat.
description: A multi-part exercise combining an upright row, external rotation, and overhead press to improve shoulder mobility and rotator cuff strength.

name: Thoracic Extension over Foam Roller
instructions: Lie on your back with a foam roller positioned horizontally across your mid/upper back.
Bend knees, feet flat on floor.
Support your head with your hands (interlace fingers behind head).
Keep hips on the floor or slightly lifted.
Gently arch your upper back over the roller, extending your thoracic spine.
Support your head throughout.
Hold the gentle extension or perform small movements.
Can slightly shift roller position up or down the upper back.
Breathe deeply.
description: Using a foam roller to improve extension mobility in the upper/mid back (thoracic spine).

name: Cat-Cow
instructions: Start on hands and knees, hands under shoulders, knees under hips.
Inhale: Drop belly, arch back, lift head and tailbone (Cow Pose).
Exhale: Round spine towards ceiling, tuck chin and tailbone (Cat Pose).
Flow smoothly between poses, coordinating with breath.
Focus on articulating through the entire spine.
Repeat.
description: A yoga pose involving flexing and extending the spine to improve mobility and relieve tension.

name: Bird Dog (Stability Focus)
instructions: Start on hands and knees, neutral spine, core engaged.
Slowly extend opposite arm and leg simultaneously.
Focus intensely on preventing any movement or rotation in the torso and pelvis.
Keep hips and shoulders perfectly square to the floor.
Reach long.
Hold briefly, maintaining tension and stability.
Return slowly to start.
Alternate sides.
Emphasis is on control and stability, not speed or range.
Repeat.
description: Performing the Bird Dog exercise with a primary focus on maintaining absolute core and spinal stability throughout the movement.
